commit_message:
Add engine support for node_create2

This patch adds engine support for node_create2.

Change-Id: I8f81d57f924ef4392bd3b93d2a3553b60bbc8e8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/52/390152/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from senlin.objects.requests import nodes as orno @mock.patch.object(action_mod.Action, 'create') @mock.patch('senlin.engine.node.Node') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') @mock.patch.object(dispatcher, 'start_action') def test_node_create2(self, notify, mock_profile, mock_node, mock_action): mock_profile.return_value = mock.Mock(id='PROFILE_ID') x_node = mock.Mock(id='NODE_ID') x_node.to_dict.return_value = {'foo': 'bar'} mock_node.return_value = x_node mock_action.return_value = 'ACTION_ID' req = orno.NodeCreateRequestBody(name='NODE1', profile_id='FAKE_PROFILE') result = self.eng.node_create2(self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual({'foo': 'bar', 'action': 'ACTION_ID'}, result) mock_profile.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'FAKE_PROFILE') mock_node.assert_called_once_with( 'NODE1', 'PROFILE_ID', '', self.ctx, index=-1, role='', metadata={}, user=self.ctx.user, project=self.ctx.project, domain=self.ctx.domain) x_node.store.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx) mock_action.assert_called_once_with( self.ctx, 'NODE_ID', consts.NODE_CREATE, name='node_create_NODE_ID', cause=action_mod.CAUSE_RPC, status=action_mod.Action.READY) notify.assert_called_once_with() @mock.patch.object(action_mod.Action, 'create') @mock.patch('senlin.engine.node.Node') @mock.patch.object(co.Cluster, 'get_next_index') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') @mock.patch.object(dispatcher, 'start_action') def test_node_create2_same_profile(self, notify, mock_profile, mock_cluster, mock_index, mock_node, mock_action): mock_profile.return_value = mock.Mock(id='PROFILE_ID', type='PROFILE_TYPE') x_cluster = mock.Mock(id='CLUSTER_ID', profile_id='PROFILE_ID') mock_cluster.return_value = x_cluster mock_index.return_value = 12345 x_node = mock.Mock(id='NODE_ID') x_node.to_dict.return_value = {'foo': 'bar'} mock_node.return_value = x_node mock_action.return_value = 'ACTION_ID' req = orno.NodeCreateRequestBody(name='NODE1', profile_id='FAKE_PROFILE', cluster_id='FAKE_CLUSTER') result = self.eng.node_create2(self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual({'foo': 'bar', 'action': 'ACTION_ID'}, result) mock_cluster.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'FAKE_CLUSTER') mock_profile.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'FAKE_PROFILE') mock_index.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'CLUSTER_ID') mock_node.assert_called_once_with( 'NODE1', 'PROFILE_ID', 'CLUSTER_ID', self.ctx, index=12345, role='', metadata={}, user=self.ctx.user, project=self.ctx.project, domain=self.ctx.domain) x_node.store.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx) mock_action.assert_called_once_with( self.ctx, 'NODE_ID', consts.NODE_CREATE, name='node_create_NODE_ID', cause=action_mod.CAUSE_RPC, status=action_mod.Action.READY) notify.assert_called_once_with() @mock.patch.object(action_mod.Action, 'create') @mock.patch('senlin.engine.node.Node') @mock.patch.object(co.Cluster, 'get_next_index') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') @mock.patch.object(dispatcher, 'start_action') def test_node_create2_same_profile_type(self, notify, mock_profile, mock_cluster, mock_index, mock_node, mock_action): mock_profile.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(id='NODE_PROFILE_ID', type='PROFILE_TYPE'), mock.Mock(id='CLUSTER_PROFILE_ID', type='PROFILE_TYPE'), ] x_cluster = mock.Mock(id='CLUSTER_ID', profile_id='CLUSTER_PROFILE_ID') mock_cluster.return_value = x_cluster mock_index.return_value = 12345 x_node = mock.Mock(id='NODE_ID') x_node.to_dict.return_value = {'foo': 'bar'} mock_node.return_value = x_node mock_action.return_value = 'ACTION_ID' req = orno.NodeCreateRequestBody(name='NODE1', profile_id='FAKE_PROFILE', cluster_id='FAKE_CLUSTER') result = self.eng.node_create2(self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual({'foo': 'bar', 'action': 'ACTION_ID'}, result) mock_cluster.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'FAKE_CLUSTER') mock_profile.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'FAKE_PROFILE'), # for node mock.call(self.ctx, 'CLUSTER_PROFILE_ID'), # for cluster ]) mock_index.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'CLUSTER_ID') mock_node.assert_called_once_with( 'NODE1', 'NODE_PROFILE_ID', 'CLUSTER_ID', self.ctx, index=12345, role='', metadata={}, user=self.ctx.user, project=self.ctx.project, domain=self.ctx.domain) x_node.store.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx) mock_action.assert_called_once_with( self.ctx, 'NODE_ID', consts.NODE_CREATE, name='node_create_NODE_ID', cause=action_mod.CAUSE_RPC, status=action_mod.Action.READY) notify.assert_called_once_with() @mock.patch.object(no.Node, 'get_by_name') def test_node_create2_name_conflict(self, mock_get): cfg.CONF.set_override('name_unique', True, enforce_type=True) mock_get.return_value = mock.Mock() req = orno.NodeCreateRequestBody(name='NODE1', profile_id='FAKE_PROFILE') ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.node_create2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual(_("The request is malformed: The node named " "(NODE1) already exists."), six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') def test_node_create2_profile_not_found(self, mock_profile): mock_profile.side_effect = exc.ResourceNotFound(type='profile', id='Bogus') req = orno.NodeCreateRequestBody(name='NODE1', profile_id='Bogus') ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.node_create2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: The specified profile " "(Bogus) could not be found.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) mock_profile.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'Bogus') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') def test_node_create2_cluster_not_found(self, mock_profile, mock_cluster): mock_profile.return_value = mock.Mock() mock_cluster.side_effect = exc.ResourceNotFound(type='cluster', id='Bogus') req = orno.NodeCreateRequestBody(name='NODE1', profile_id='FAKE_PROFILE', cluster_id='Bogus') ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.node_create2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: The specified cluster " "(Bogus) could not be found.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) mock_profile.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'FAKE_PROFILE') mock_cluster.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'Bogus') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'profile_find') def test_node_create2_profile_type_not_match(self, mock_profile, mock_cluster): mock_profile.side_effect = [ mock.Mock(id='NODE_PROFILE_ID', type='TYPE-A'), mock.Mock(id='CLUSTER_PROFILE_ID', type='TYPE-B'), ] mock_cluster.return_value = mock.Mock(id='CLUSTER_ID', profile_id='CLUSTER_PROFILE_ID') req = orno.NodeCreateRequestBody(name='NODE1', profile_id='NODE_PROFILE', cluster_id='FAKE_CLUSTER') ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.node_create2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.ProfileTypeNotMatch, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("Node and cluster have different profile type, " "operation aborted.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) mock_profile.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(self.ctx, 'NODE_PROFILE'), mock.call(self.ctx, 'CLUSTER_PROFILE_ID'), ]) mock_cluster.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'FAKE_CLUSTER')

subject: Use Password Generation provided by the Mistral workflows
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 07:53:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/1d4c0a0d4b5dc270fc7b3d0174cb3008d3b589a4', 'message': 'Use Password Generation provided by the Mistral workflows

Password generation was recently added to tripleo-common and the Mistral
workflows. This patch removes the generation code from tripleoclient as it is
no longer needed.

Closes-Bug: #1632013
Co-Authored-By: Dougal Matthews <dougal@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I3b1ac9952d6c46a1be7d1374d613f829d6c8ca5e
Depends-On: I94428d1deb000c65a1c0266d01f660b76d4a3ee5

commit_message:
Use Password Generation provided by the Mistral workflows

Password generation was recently added to tripleo-common and the Mistral
workflows. This patch removes the generation code from tripleoclient as it is
no longer needed.

Closes-Bug: #1632013
Co-Authored-By: Dougal Matthews <dougal@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I3b1ac9952d6c46a1be7d1374d613f829d6c8ca5e
Depends-On: I94428d1deb000c65a1c0266d01f660b76d4a3ee5
Change-Id: Ibe76a40b4d19219aa8e4fc72ddde519ea6f6d2ba
(cherry picked from commit b1c17ba1f7c45940eb0fdf05fe0f772dc1c838a1)

commit_message:
Add support for bindep.txt

Currently, this is a noop, since diskimage-builder currently uses
tests/install_test_deps.sh to manage OS dependencies. The next patch
in the series, will complete the migration to bindep.

Change-Id: I3b599983106b87fec6a4b6348469ed037654810e
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix IndexError in volume manager

A list comprehension in volume manager can raise IndexError due
to unsafe assumption of input.  This change fix it by not assuming
list comprehension always return none empty list.  This also fixes
a snapshot DB call by using OVO.

Change-Id: I83e8ac8dcf9e84b37847d6eb09065d55e843f82e
Closes-bug: #1628340
(cherry picked from commit d96fb9a10135df062732279bac2d7eb6073872b0)

Request object for node-create

This patch adds verioned object for node-create requests.

commit_message:
action handler support batch policy

This patch for the action handler layer.
The action will update the cluster by the plan
we created if user bind batch policy to the cluster.

Change-Id: I42fc8cf2d255580c57990d686c24b620abd1cde8
Implements: blueprint support-batching-policy
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/41/385741/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _check_dependents(self, total, executed, ready, min_in_service): # check executed action status first reason = _('Ready for executing') dependents = self._count_dependents() while dependents != 0: rest_of_nodes = total - executed - ready succeeded = executed - dependents # check the status if (rest_of_nodes + succeeded) >= min_in_service: return True, reason else: scheduler.reschedule(self.id, 5) dependents = self._count_dependents() return True, reason def _check_status(self, action_list, ready_for_executed, min_in_service): total = no.Node.count_by_cluster(self.context, self.target) executed = len(action_list) ready = len(ready_for_executed) reason = _('Ready for executing') if executed == 0 or min_in_service == 0: return True, reason res, reason = self._check_dependents(total, executed, ready, min_in_service) status = self.get_status() if status == self.FAILED or self.is_cancelled() or self.is_timeout(): reason = _('%(action)s [%(id)s] failed') % { 'action': self.action, 'id': self.id[:8]} LOG.debug(reason) return False, reason return res, reason def _update_nodes(self, profile_id): # Get batching policy data if any fmt = _LI("Updating cluster '%(cluster)s': profile='%(profile)s'.") LOG.info(fmt, {'cluster': self.cluster.id, 'profile': profile_id}) pause_time = 0 plan = [] min_in_service = 0 pd = self.data.get('update', None) if pd: pause_time = pd.get('pause_time') min_in_service = pd.get('min_in_service') plan = pd.get('plan') else: pause_time = 0 min_in_service = 0 nodes_list = [] for node in self.cluster.nodes: nodes_list.append(node.id) plan.append(set(nodes_list)) data = { 'update': { 'pause_time': pause_time, 'min_in_service': min_in_service, 'plan': plan, } } self.data.update(data) nodes = [] executed_action = [] for node_set in plan: child = [] nodes = list(node_set) # check if number of nodes in service greater than min_in_service res, reason = self._check_status(executed_action, nodes, min_in_service) if not res: self.cluster.eval_status(self.context, self.CLUSTER_UPDATE) return res, reason for node in nodes: kwargs = { 'name': 'node_update_%s' % node[:8], 'cause': base.CAUSE_DERIVED, 'inputs': { 'new_profile_id': profile_id, }, } action_id = base.Action.create(self.context, node, consts.NODE_UPDATE, **kwargs) child.append(action_id) if child: dobj.Dependency.create(self.context, [c for c in child], self.id) for cid in child: ao.Action.update(self.context, cid, {'status': base.Action.READY}) executed_action.append(cid) dispatcher.start_action() # clear the action list child = [] # pause time if pause_time != 0: self._sleep(pause_time) result, new_reason = self._wait_for_dependents() if result != self.RES_OK: self.cluster.eval_status(self.context, self.CLUSTER_UPDATE) return result, _('Failed in updating nodes.') self.cluster.profile_id = profile_id self.cluster.eval_status(self.context, self.CLUSTER_UPDATE, profile_id=profile_id, updated_at=timeutils.utcnow(True)) return self.RES_OK, 'Cluster update completed.' # Update nodes with new profile result, reason = self._update_nodes(profile_id)
deleted_lines: fmt = _LI("Updating cluster '%(cluster)s': profile='%(profile)s'.") LOG.info(fmt, {'cluster': self.cluster.id, 'profile': profile_id}) child = [] for node in self.cluster.nodes: kwargs = { 'name': 'node_update_%s' % node.id[:8], 'cause': base.CAUSE_DERIVED, 'inputs': { 'new_profile_id': profile_id, }, } action_id = base.Action.create(self.context, node.id, consts.NODE_UPDATE, **kwargs) child.append(action_id) if child: dobj.Dependency.create(self.context, [c for c in child], self.id) for cid in child: ao.Action.update(self.context, cid, {'status': base.Action.READY}) dispatcher.start_action() result, new_reason = self._wait_for_dependents() if result != self.RES_OK: self.cluster.eval_status(self.context, self.CLUSTER_UPDATE) return result, _('Failed in updating nodes.') self.cluster.profile_id = profile_id self.cluster.eval_status(self.context, self.CLUSTER_UPDATE, profile_id=profile_id, updated_at=timeutils.utcnow(True))

Change-Id: Ia619cc7a1a4e4ee4d7332c3e3e215cea00ca3328
Closes-Bug: 1482271
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-27 16:13:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/bbb058055703284e236cc8b737415ebc2d7f9ea2', 'message': "Protect WSGI application with a critical section

When configured as an Apache WSGI module a race condition
is possible during keystone cache initialization.
The operation raises exception region.RegionAlreadyConfigured.
This is a result of the race condition involving global
'application' variable being initialized several times
(1 per thread).
Apache modwsgi documentation suggests protecting global objects
with thread locks.

Change-Id: Ia619cc7a1a4e4ee4d7332c3e3e215cea00ca3328
Closes-Bug: 1482271
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-27 16:15:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/11a7fd1a24ed8099dfe84d7b825bd6b1c023fce2', 'message': "Protect WSGI application with a critical section

When configured as an Apache WSGI module a race condition
is possible during keystone cache initialization.
The operation raises exception region.RegionAlreadyConfigured.
This is a result of the race condition involving global
'application' variable being initialized several times
(1 per thread).
Apache modwsgi documentation suggests protecting global objects
with thread locks.

commit_message:
Protect initialization with critical sections

When configured as an Apache WSGI module a race condition
is possible during keystone cache initialization.
The operation raises exception region.RegionAlreadyConfigured.
This is a result of the race condition involving global
'application' variable being initialized several times
(1 per thread).
Apache modwsgi documentation suggests protecting global objects
with thread locks.

Change-Id: Ia619cc7a1a4e4ee4d7332c3e3e215cea00ca3328
Closes-Bug: 1482271
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/01/210001/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import threadingapplication = None # NOTE(amakarov): Apache modwsgi spec requires to protect global variables # http://code.google.com/p/modwsgi/wiki/ProcessesAndThreading app_lock = threading.Lock() with app_lock: if application is None: application = wsgi_server.initialize_application(name)

commit_message:
Retrive DB object after update

Revision numbers are bumped in the db flush callback.
It doesn't work well for us because we have surrounding transactions,
which would defer object flushing.

This commit workarounds the issue by retrieving DB objects again.

An alternative would be to make the base class methods provide
DB object for us, similarly to what create methods do.

I don't quite understand why expire_all() is necessary, but without
having them in update_port, get_port() sometimes (not always) see
the previous values of attributes and it makes some tests including
the following ones fail occasionally.

    neutron.tests.tempest.api.test_extension_driver_port_security.PortSecTest.test_port_sec_update_pass
    neutron.tests.tempest.api.test_extension_driver_port_security.PortSecTest.test_port_sec_update_port_failed

Closes-Bug: #1633334
Change-Id: I370a2e5e987c177c540f1a0241212de62da1d930
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/96/386396/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # REVISIT(yamamoto): Retrieve the db object to get the correct revision return self.get_network(context, id) # REVISIT(yamamoto): Retrieve the db object to get the correct revision return self.get_subnet(context, id) # REVISIT(yamamoto): Retrieve the db object to get the correct revision return self.get_port(context, id)
deleted_lines: return net return s return p

subject: elements: zypper: Do not pull recommended packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 18:20:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/4088163c9763ce8fe661d1c372f63d66e990553e', 'message': "elements: zypper: Drop not pull recommended packages

Recommended packages are usually useful but we normally don't need
them in order to have a working system. As a result, avoid pulling
them in when doing a regular package installation or a distribution
update. Extra packages can be pulled in using the usual '-p' parameter
or from within the elements that actually need them. Finally, pull the
python-pip package explicitely in the zypper-minimal element since we
may need it very early in the image generation process and it is not
longer pulled when we are installing without the recommended packages.
The results of this change are quite significant, resulting to gains
from a few dozen of MBs up to a few hundred depending on the selected
elements.

Change-Id: I5838829c631990c7a1f3b67548accd9a603fe20c

commit_message:
elements: zypper: Do not pull recommended packages

Recommended packages are usually useful but we normally don't need
them in order to have a working system. As a result, avoid pulling
them in when doing a regular package installation or a distribution
update. Extra packages can be pulled in using the usual '-p' parameter
or from within the elements that actually need them. The results of
this change are quite significant, resulting to gains from a few dozen
of MBs up to a few hundred depending on the selected elements.

Change-Id: I5838829c631990c7a1f3b67548accd9a603fe20c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/47/388847/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo zypper ${ZYPPER_TARGET_OPTS} install ${ZYPPER_INSTALL_OPTS} python python-pip zypper

commit_message:
Add delete action for angular profile panel

This patch implement delete action for angular profile panel.

Change-Id: I7d3037425a2a1886b2fc8238fcb352535fe198a6
Partial-Implements: blueprint angularize-profile-tables
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin-dashboard refs/changes/27/387827/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may * not use self file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain * a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; angular .module('horizon.cluster.profiles') .factory('horizon.cluster.profiles.actions.delete.service', deleteService); deleteService.$inject = [ '$q', 'horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.senlin', 'horizon.framework.util.actions.action-result.service', 'horizon.framework.util.i18n.gettext', 'horizon.framework.util.q.extensions', 'horizon.framework.widgets.modal.deleteModalService', 'horizon.framework.widgets.toast.service', 'horizon.app.core.profiles.resourceType' ]; /* * @ngdoc factory * @name horizon.app.core.profiles.actions.delete.service * * @Description * Brings up the delete profiles confirmation modal dialog. * On submit, delete given profiles. * On cancel, do nothing. */ function deleteService( $q, senlin, actionResultService, gettext, $qExtensions, deleteModal, toast, profilesResourceType ) { var scope, context; var notAllowedMessage = gettext("You are not allowed to delete profiles: %s"); var service = { initScope: initScope, allowed: allowed, perform: perform }; return service; ////////////// function initScope(newScope) { scope = newScope; context = { }; } function perform(items) { var profiles = angular.isArray(items) ? items : [items]; context.labels = labelize(profiles.length); context.deleteEntity = deleteProfile; return $qExtensions.allSettled(profiles.map(checkPermission)).then(afterCheck); } function allowed() { return $q.all([ $qExtensions.booleanAsPromise(true) ]); } function checkPermission(profile) { return {promise: allowed(profile), context: profile}; } function afterCheck(result) { var outcome = $q.reject(); // Reject the promise by default if (result.fail.length > 0) { toast.add('error', getMessage(notAllowedMessage, result.fail)); outcome = $q.reject(result.fail); } if (result.pass.length > 0) { outcome = deleteModal.open(scope, result.pass.map(getEntity), context).then(createResult); } return outcome; } function createResult(deleteModalResult) { var actionResult = actionResultService.getActionResult(); deleteModalResult.pass.forEach(function markDeleted(item) { actionResult.deleted(profilesResourceType, getEntity(item).id); }); deleteModalResult.fail.forEach(function markFailed(item) { actionResult.failed(profilesResourceType, getEntity(item).id); }); return actionResult.result; } function labelize(count) { return { title: ngettext( 'Confirm Delete Profile', 'Confirm Delete Profiles', count), message: ngettext( 'You have selected "%s". Deleted Profile is not recoverable.', 'You have selected "%s". Deleted Profiles are not recoverable.', count), submit: ngettext( 'Delete Profile', 'Delete Profiles', count), success: ngettext( 'Deleted Profile: %s.', 'Deleted Profiles: %s.', count), error: ngettext( 'Unable to delete Profile: %s.', 'Unable to delete Profiles: %s.', count) }; } function deleteProfile(profile) { return senlin.deleteProfile(profile, true); } function getMessage(message, entities) { return interpolate(message, [entities.map(getName).join(", ")]); } function getName(result) { return getEntity(result).name; } function getEntity(result) { return result.context; } } })();

subject: Revert "Fix grub installation for RHEL"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 06:52:34.000000000', 'files': ['elements/redhat-common/pre-install.d/15-remove-grub'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/51c3e2a84f2a1ffc1c1397db301671532065c13a', 'message': 'Revert "Fix grub installation for RHEL"

This reverts commit 93425d14ce251139e0518a3a9533506dd1615f97.

This is failing the fedora-minimal build, because grub2-tools is
already installed by package-map.yaml.  With this, we download grub2 &
grub2-tools (because we're getting grub-pc) and then we try to install
it *again* with the final script we setup; rpm bails out saying
package already installed.

Looking at this more closely, I feel like this is the wrong solution,
because grub2-tools should be installed by the package-map.yaml file
even on RHEL.  The logs in bug #1627000 aren't sufficient for me to
tell exactly what is going on.

Change-Id: I884cb1e78ad8c31d985f3fc94a58091b993edd7d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix grub installation for RHEL"

This reverts commit 93425d14ce251139e0518a3a9533506dd1615f97.

This is failing the fedora-minimal build, because grub2-tools is
already installed by package-map.yaml.  With this, we download grub2 &
grub2-tools (because we're getting grub-pc) and then we try to install
it *again* with the final script we setup; rpm bails out saying
package already installed.

Looking at this more closely, I feel like this is the wrong solution,
because grub2-tools should be installed by the package-map.yaml file
even on RHEL.  The logs in bug #1627000 aren't sufficient for me to
tell exactly what is going on.

Change-Id: I884cb1e78ad8c31d985f3fc94a58091b993edd7d

commit_message:
[upstream] Revise closing exercise section

- To make a generalized exercise, this commit changes from
  Spain travel plan to a plan for a country where group members
  would like to visit.
- IRC meeting info is added to encourage students to have
  meeting for discussion.
- Let's try students to improve the patchset they first submitted
  as a draft.
- More steps would be to expand with trip details as a blueprint.

Change-Id: I3415b5dd13fcca2d615384fd189c64c5416fbba8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/25/390125/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Group Exercise 1 ================ - Decide a country your group would like to visit and invite other groups for sightseeing. - Design an 5-day travel itinerary with attractive places, foods, and activities. - Create a draft .rst file with an outline for the itinerary. Submit a patch to the sandbox when you are finished. Example Itinerary: Spain ======================== Group Exercise 2 ================ - Open an *upstream training exercise* IRC meeting and make consensus from various travel plans. - Example of helpful IRC commands: .. code-block:: console #startmeeting upstream training exeicise #topic Spain tour #startvote Day 2: Cava & Winery Tour vs. Barcelona downtown #endvote #endmeeting - Revise the original patch according to discussion results. - Include concrete activities and times and any other details your group think.
deleted_lines: Exercise 1 ========== Create an .rst file with an outline of a 5 day trip to Spain. Include activities and times and any other details you think would help you sell the trip to someone. Submit the patch to the sandbox when you're finished. Example Itinerary =================

commit_message:
Add subgraph execution support

Add -S  option to support subgraph execution. This would allow a user
to pick which tasks to stop on.

Example:

fuel2 graph execute -S keystone-db:openstack-controller/1

will start with all keystone-db tasks and end at openstack-controller at
node-1

DocImpact

Closes-bug: 1612616

Change-Id: I42f9caf2e9c18072a2ae0447df2ba3500f687d5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient refs/changes/84/370084/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Change apache2 CGI module for RadosGW

In apache-2.4.7 fastcgi module is not support chunked transfer.
It breaks uploads of objects to RadosGW.
Fix available since apache-2.4.10 (vivid) and upgrade apache in MOS is not
possible, so this workaround proposed.
RadosGW runs with native CGI server on 127.0.0.1:9000 and apache uses
mod_proxy_fcgi to proxy user requests to rados.

Closes-bug: #1505273

Conflicts:
	deployment/puppet/ceph/manifests/init.pp

Change-Id: Ia3959c4009c6c673074a9b7536b1cc87834c301d
(cherry picked from commit b092234605defaf6e41b15dc949472bd4b2d04ee)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/83/301083/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RewriteRule .* - [E=HTTP_AUTHORIZATION:%{HTTP:Authorization},L] SetEnv proxy-nokeepalive 1 ProxyPass / fcgi://127.0.0.1:9000/
deleted_lines: FastCgiExternalServer <%= @dir_httpd_root %>/s3gw.fcgi -socket /tmp/radosgw.sock RewriteRule ^/([a-zA-Z0-9-_.]*)([/]?.*) /s3gw.fcgi?page=$1&params=$2&%{QUERY_STRING} [E=HTTP_AUTHORIZATION:%{HTTP:Authorization},L] <IfModule mod_fastcgi.c> <Directory <%= @dir_httpd_root %>> Options +ExecCGI AllowOverride All SetHandler fastcgi-script Order allow,deny Allow from all AuthBasicAuthoritative Off </Directory> </IfModule>

commit_message:
Add apache mod_proxy for ceph radosgw

With the switch to fcgi for radosgw we need to include mod_proxy as
mod_proxy_fcgi requires it. This change pulls in the proxy module to
resolve apache2 startup failures when ceph is enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1505273
(cherry picked from commit ac654f2a5bac67ee8bd8330cb4b8443a84b3ea28)
Change-Id: I7044b58066e70b11ed9358579a2f369ce761ee06

commit_message:
Fix command line help

Setting up Python's argument parser was broken here.  Everything
needed rewriting...

Change-Id: I210cc1217bfa6ffd74c89974d0587934a9e1a726
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/molteniron refs/changes/17/390417/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create a decorator pattern that maintains a registry def makeRegistrar(): registry = {} def registrar(func): registry[func.__name__] = func # normally a decorator returns a wrapped function, # but here we return func unmodified, after registering it return func registrar.all = registry return registrar # Create the decorator command = makeRegistrar() def __init__(self): self.conf = None self.argv = None self.parser = None def setup_conf(self, conf): """ """ self.conf = conf def setup_argv(self, argv): self.argv = argv def setup_parser(self, parser): self.parser = parser # Call the function specified on the command line! self.request = self.argv.func() @command def add(self, subparsers = None): if subparsers is not None: sp = subparsers.add_parser("add") # description='Add a node to the micli') sp.add_argument("name", help="Name of the baremetal node") sp.add_argument("ipmi_ip", help="IP for issuing IPMI commands to" " this node") sp.add_argument("ipmi_user", help="IPMI username used when issuing" " IPMI commands to this node") sp.add_argument("ipmi_password", help="IPMI password used when" " issuing IPMI commands to this node") sp.add_argument("allocation_pool", help="Comma separated list of" " IPs to be used in deployment") sp.add_argument("port_hwaddr", help="MAC address of port on" " machine to use during deployment") sp.add_argument("cpu_arch", help="Architecture of the node") sp.add_argument("cpus", type=int, help="Number of CPUs on the node") sp.add_argument("ram_mb", type=int, help="Amount of RAM (in MiB)" " that the node has") sp.add_argument("disk_gb", type=int, help="Amount of disk (in GiB)" " that the node has") sp.set_defaults(func=self.add) return # Make a map of our arguments request = vars(self.argv) # But delete the class function pointer. json can't serialize it! del request['func'] @command def allocate(self, subparsers = None): if subparsers is not None: sp = subparsers.add_parser("allocate") # description="Checkout a node in molteniron. Returns the node's" # " info") sp.add_argument("owner_name", help="Name of the requester") sp.add_argument("number_of_nodes", type=int, help="How many nodes to reserve") sp.set_defaults(func=self.allocate) return # Make a map of our arguments request = vars(self.argv) # But delete the class function pointer. json can't serialize it! del request['func'] @command def release(self, subparsers = None): if subparsers is not None: sp = subparsers.add_parser("release") # description="Given an owner name, release allocated node," # " returning it to the available state") sp.add_argument("owner_name", help="Name of the owner who" " currently owns the nodes to be released") sp.set_defaults(func=self.release) return # Make a map of our arguments request = vars(self.argv) # But delete the class function pointer. json can't serialize it! del request['func'] @command def get_field(self, subparsers = None): if subparsers is not None: sp = subparsers.add_parser("get_field") # description="Given an owner name and the name of a field, get" # " the value of the field") sp.add_argument("owner_name", help="Name of the owner who currently" " owns the nodes to get the field from") sp.add_argument("field_name", help="Name of the field to retrieve" " the value from") sp.set_defaults(func=self.get_field) return # Make a map of our arguments request = vars(self.argv) # But delete the class function pointer. json can't serialize it! del request['func'] @command def set_field(self, subparsers = None): if subparsers is not None: sp = subparsers.add_parser("set_field") # description="Given an id, set a field with a value") sp.add_argument("id", help="Id of the entry") sp.add_argument("key", help="Field name to set") sp.add_argument("value", help="Field value to set") sp.set_defaults(func=self.set_field) return # Make a map of our arguments request = vars(self.argv) # But delete the class function pointer. json can't serialize it! del request['func'] @command def status(self, subparsers = None): if subparsers is not None: sp = subparsers.add_parser("status") # description="Return a list of current MoltenIron Node database" # " entries") sp.set_defaults(func=self.status) return # Make a map of our arguments request = vars(self.argv) # But delete the class function pointer. json can't serialize it! del request['func'] @command def delete_db(self, subparsers = None): if subparsers is not None: sp = subparsers.add_parser("delete_db") # description="Delete every entry in the MoltenIron Node database") sp.set_defaults(func=self.delete_db) return # Make a map of our arguments request = vars(self.argv) # But delete the class function pointer. json can't serialize it! del request['func'] mi = MoltenIron() subparsers = parser.add_subparsers(help="sub-command help") # Register all decorated class functions by telling them argparse # is running for (cmd_name, cmd_func) in command.all.items(): func = getattr(mi, cmd_name) func (subparsers) # Tell the function to setup for argparse args = parser.parse_args() mi.setup_conf(conf) mi.setup_argv(args) mi.setup_parser(parser)
deleted_lines: def split_commandline_args(argv): front = [] back = [] command_found = False for elm in argv: if command_found: back.append(elm) else: front.append(elm) if elm[0] != '-': command_found = True return (front, back) def __init__(self, conf, argv): self.conf = conf (argv, rest_argv) = split_commandline_args(argv) # Parse the arguments and generate a request parser = argparse.ArgumentParser() parser.add_argument('command', help='Subcommand to run') (self.args, self.unknown_args) = parser.parse_known_args (argv) self.unknown_args += rest_argv self.request = getattr(self, self.args.command)(self.unknown_args) def add(self, argv): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description='Add a node to the micli') parser.add_argument('name', help="Name of the baremetal node") parser.add_argument('ipmi_ip', help="IP for issuing IPMI commands to" " this node") parser.add_argument('ipmi_user', help="IPMI username used when issuing" " IPMI commands to this node") parser.add_argument('ipmi_password', help="IPMI password used when" " issuing IPMI commands to this node") parser.add_argument('allocation_pool', help="Comma separated list of" " IPs to be used in deployment") parser.add_argument('port_hwaddr', help="MAC address of port on" " machine to use during deployment") parser.add_argument('cpu_arch', help="Architecture of the node") parser.add_argument('cpus', type=int, help="Number of CPUs on the" " node") parser.add_argument('ram_mb', type=int, help="Amount of RAM (in MiB)" " that the node has") parser.add_argument('disk_gb', type=int, help="Amount of disk (in GiB)" " that the node has") args = parser.parse_args(argv) request = vars(args) def allocate(self, argv): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description="Checkout a node in molteniron. Returns the node's" " info") parser.add_argument('owner_name', help="Name of the requester") parser.add_argument('number_of_nodes', type=int, help="How many nodes" " to reserve") args = parser.parse_args(argv) request = vars(args) def release(self, argv): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description="Given an owner name, release allocated node," " returning it to the available state") parser.add_argument('owner_name', help="Name of the owner who" " currently owns the nodes to be released") args = parser.parse_args(argv) request = vars(args) def get_field(self, argv): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description="Given an owner name and the name of a field, get the" " value of the field") parser.add_argument('owner_name', help="Name of the owner who" " currently owns the nodes to get the field from") parser.add_argument('field_name', help="Name of the field to retrieve" " the value from") args = parser.parse_args(argv) request = vars(args) def set_field(self, argv): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description='Given an id, set a field with a value') parser.add_argument('id', help='Id of the entry') parser.add_argument('key', help='Field name to set') parser.add_argument('value', help='Field value to set') args = parser.parse_args(argv) request = vars(args) def status(self, argv): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description="Return a list of current MoltenIron Node database" " entries") args = parser.parse_args(argv) request = vars(args) def delete_db(self, argv): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description="Delete every entry in the MoltenIron Node database") args = parser.parse_args(argv) request = vars(args) # We want individual command help later. So we need to remove a --help # found at the end of the command line as long as there is at least # one argument that doesn't start with '-'. (argv, rest_argv) = split_commandline_args(list(sys.argv[1:])) (args, unknown_args) = parser.parse_known_args (argv) unknown_args += rest_argv mi = MoltenIron(conf, unknown_args)

commit_message:
Create _setup_response()

This function will move http and json processing into a new
function done on demand after class initialization.

Change-Id: Ibf57f1e23912f7878287c6f85efd9ea93c7f13a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/molteniron refs/changes/15/390415/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: (self.args, self.unknown_args) = parser.parse_known_args (argv) self.unknown_args += rest_argv self.request = None self.response_str = None self.response_json = None def _setup_response(self): """ """ if self.request is not None: return self.request = getattr(self, self.args.command)(self.unknown_args) self.response_str = self.send(self.request) self._setup_response() self._setup_response()
deleted_lines: (args, unknown_args) = parser.parse_known_args (argv) unknown_args += rest_argv request = getattr(self, args.command)(unknown_args) self.response_str = self.send(request)

commit_message:
Updating logging information for Syntribos

As syntribos is no longer using opencafe for logging, updating
the present structure of debug logs and also how they are saved.

Change-Id: Ied53d42c5611f72820745de85c674a19cf51481a
Closes-Bug: #1632752

Logs are found in ``.opencafe/logs/`` Logs are then arranged in directories based on each Syntribos configuration file, and then by date and time. Rather than copy the maps passed to map_merge, safely store references
to the original maps (read-only). Of course, the maps are garbage

commit_message:
Do not copy original maps in map_merge

Rather than copy the maps passed to map_merge, safely store references
to the original maps (read-only). Of course, the maps are garbage
collected in the original implementation, eventually. This is just an
optimization to avoid using extra memory before the GC takes place.

Change-Id: Ie9636e9483e91e40c9b092fbc3a0b4b8a6218685
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/11/385111/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class MapMergedMap(collections.Mapping): """A class that merges maps without copying them in memory.""" def __init__(self, maps): # maps is a list of maps. # lower index maps take precedence. # we may only edit the first map in self.maps, intialized as empty. self.maps = [{}] for m in maps: if m: self.maps.append(m) self.deleted_keys = None def __setitem__(self, key, item): self.maps[0][key] = item if self.deleted_keys: self.deleted_keys.discard(key) def __getitem__(self, key): if self.deleted_keys and key in self.deleted_keys: raise KeyError(key) for m in self.maps[:-1]: if key in m: return m[key] return self.maps[-1][key] def __repr__(self): d = {'classname': type(self).__name__} d.update(self.__dict__) return repr(d) def __len__(self): return len(self.keys()) def __delitem__(self, key): # raises a KeyError if no key to delete self.__getitem__(key) if self.deleted_keys is None: self.deleted_keys = set() self.deleted_keys.add(key) if key in self.maps[0]: del self.maps[0][key] def clear(self): self.maps = [{}] self.deleted_keys = None def copy(self): return MapMergedMap([self]) def has_key(self, k): try: self.__getitem__(k) return True except KeyError: return False def pop(self, k, d=None): if k not in self.has_key(k): # noqa if d is not None: return d else: raise KeyError(k) # TODO(cwolfe), optimize this retval = self.__getitem__(k) self.__delitem__(k) return retval def update(self, *args, **kwargs): if args and args[0]: for k in args[0]: self.__setitem__(k, args[0][k]) for k, v in kwargs.items(): self.__setitem__(k, v) def _next_uniq_key(self): seen = set() for k in itertools.chain(*[six.iterkeys(m) for m in self.maps]): if (k not in seen and (self.deleted_keys is None or k not in self.deleted_keys)): seen.add(k) yield k def __iter__(self): return self._next_uniq_key() def keys(self): return list(self._next_uniq_key()) def values(self): return list(self.__getitem__(k) for k in self._next_uniq_key()) def items(self): return list((k, self.__getitem__(k)) for k in self._next_uniq_key()) {"<k1>": "<v3>", "<k2>": "<v2>"} for m in args: ensure_map(m) return MapMergedMap(reversed(args))
deleted_lines: {"<k1>": "<v2>", "<k2>": "<v3>"} ret_map = {} for m in args: ret_map.update(ensure_map(m)) return ret_map

Adding Cinder extension support to templates

Added support for snapshots to extension client, added calls in
templates for volume, volume type, and snapshots.

classifier section.

commit_message:
Disable ext4 userns when running in a container

/sys is read-only when using an LXD contianer due
to lxcfs. So detect if we are running the charm inside
a container and prevent ext4 userns from being
configured.

Closes-Bug: #1635659

Change-Id: Ia0668ea473ec1e80dd8b0a1136061a430883b0ec
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit c0d0fc50418867e702430f4d655da89f794e1f73)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-lxd refs/changes/11/390211/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # /sys is read-only when using a container container_check = check_output(['systemd-detect-virt']).strip() if (container_check != 'lxc' and os.path.exists(EXT4_USERNS_MOUNTS)):

commit_message:
Disable ext4 userns when running in a container

/sys is read-only when using an LXD contianer due
to lxcfs. So detect if we are running the charm inside
a container and prevent ext4 userns from being
configured.

Closes-Bug: #1635659

Change-Id: Ia0668ea473ec1e80dd8b0a1136061a430883b0ec
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-lxd refs/changes/40/389740/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # /sys is read-only when using a container container_check = check_output(['systemd-detect-virt']) if container_check != 'lxc': if os.path.exists(EXT4_USERNS_MOUNTS): with open(EXT4_USERNS_MOUNTS, 'w') as userns_mounts: userns_mounts.write( 'Y\n' if config('enable-ext4-userns') else 'N\n' )
deleted_lines: if os.path.exists(EXT4_USERNS_MOUNTS): with open(EXT4_USERNS_MOUNTS, 'w') as userns_mounts: userns_mounts.write( 'Y\n' if config('enable-ext4-userns') else 'N\n' )

commit_message:
Fix LOG.warn to LOG.warning

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3.
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: I7ce17879a0925fbd9f93383dab9b06fc810eacf2

commit_message:
Add more debugging when moltenirond-helper fails

Added custom Exception classes and raised them in get_moltenirond_pid.

Added log_error to log to stderr and a logfile
called /tmp/MoltenIron-error-logfile.

Change-Id: I2855cf832c2a1a8f5ef9df34cf96706eb5406276
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/molteniron refs/changes/87/390387/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ERROR_LOGFILE = "/tmp/MoltenIron-error-logfile" class MoltenIronPIDNotFound(RuntimeError): """os.path.isfile() error: The PID file does not exist""" class MoltenIronKillError(RuntimeError): """os.kill() error""" class MoltenIronReadLinesError(RuntimeError): """fobj.readlines() error""" raise MoltenIronPIDNotFound("isfile error %s" % (PID, )) except Exception as e: raise MoltenIronKillError("os.kill error: %s" % (e, )) except Exception as e: raise MoltenIronReadLinesError("readlines error: %s" % (e, ))def log_error(s): with open(ERROR_LOGFILE, "a+") as fobj: fobj.writelines(s + "\n") print >> sys.stderr, s log_error(msg) try: pid = get_moltenirond_pid() except MoltenIronPIDNotFound: pid = -1 if pid > 0: log_error("Error: The daemon is already running") try: pid = get_moltenirond_pid() if pid > 0: os.remove (PID) os.kill(pid, signal.SIGTERM) else: log_error("Error: The daemon doesn't exist?") log_error("Error: pid = %d" % (pid, )) sys.exit(1) except Exception as e: log_error("Error: The daemon doesn't exist?") log_error("Error: %s" % (e, )) log_error(msg)
deleted_lines: return -1 except Exception: return -1 except Exception: return -1 print >> sys.stderr, msg pid = get_moltenirond_pid() if pid > 0: print >> sys.stderr, "Error: The daemon is already running" pid = get_moltenirond_pid() if pid > 0: os.remove (PID) os.kill(pid, signal.SIGTERM) else: print >> sys.stderr, "Error: The daemon doesn't exist?" print >> sys.stderr, msg

subject: Fix return values of consistencygroup actions in Pure storage driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 14:43:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/afeae843c14dcf6556d3dcf8473958c3e9f0812b', 'message': 'Fix return values of consistencygroup actions in Pure storage driver

- create_consistencygroup_from_src
- delete_consistencygroup
- create_cgsnapshot
- delete_cgsnapshot

Resource updates are taken care by VolumeManager and in the above listed
actions, resource_id and resource_status are updated more than once. Also,
inconsistencies could result in some cases, for example in
delete_consistencygroup method in VolumeManager class, we update DB with
volume_id and volume_status returned from the driver by calling
db.volume_update and before calling db.volume_destroy that later updates rest
of the fields(along with updating id and status again), another process could
be reading the DB. To avoid multiple DB updates and inconsistencies, the return
values of these methods in the driver could be set to None.

Change-Id: I0187c7ea633c3061322116a1019abb7f0df34ee3
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-18 14:46:24.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/pure.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_pure.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/ea97d8f93aa2998c042f44760d3856922365dc77', 'message': 'Fix return values of consistencygroup actions in Pure storage driver

- create_consistencygroup_from_src
- delete_consistencygroup
- create_cgsnapshot
- delete_cgsnapshot

Resource updates are taken care by VolumeManager and in the above listed
actions, resource_id and resource_status are updated more than once.
Also, inconsistencies could result in some cases, for example in
delete_consistencygroup method in VolumeManager class, we update DB with
volume_id and volume_status returned from the driver by calling
db.volume_update and before calling db.volume_destroy that later updates
rest of the fields(along with updating id and status again), another
process could be reading the DB. To avoid multiple DB updates and
inconsistencies, the return values of these methods in the driver could
be set to None.

Change-Id: I0187c7ea633c3061322116a1019abb7f0df34ee3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix return values of consistencygroup actions in Pure storage driver

- create_consistencygroup_from_src
- delete_consistencygroup
- create_cgsnapshot
- delete_cgsnapshot

Resource updates are taken care by VolumeManager and in the above listed
actions, resource_id and resource_status are updated more than once.
Also, inconsistencies could result in some cases, for example in
delete_consistencygroup method in VolumeManager class, we update DB with
volume_id and volume_status returned from the driver by calling
db.volume_update and before calling db.volume_destroy that later updates
rest of the fields(along with updating id and status again), another
process could be reading the DB. To avoid multiple DB updates and
inconsistencies, the return values of these methods in the driver could
be set to None.

Change-Id: I0187c7ea633c3061322116a1019abb7f0df34ee3

deleted_lines: self.driver.create_consistencygroup_from_src( self.driver.create_consistencygroup_from_src( expected_volume_updates = [{ 'id': mock_volume.id, 'status': 'deleted' }] self.assertEqual(expected_volume_updates, volumes) self.assertEqual(mock_cgroup['status'], model_update['status']) self.assertEqual({'status': 'available'}, model_update) expected_snapshot_update = [{ 'id': mock_snap.id, 'status': 'available' }] self.assertEqual(expected_snapshot_update, snapshots) self.assertEqual({'status': mock_cgsnap.status}, model_update) expected_snapshot_update = [{ 'id': mock_snap.id, 'status': 'deleted' }] self.assertEqual(expected_snapshot_update, snapshots)

added_lines: def get_cephfs(service): """ List the Ceph Filesystems that exist :rtype : list. Returns a list of the ceph filesystems :param service: The service name to run the ceph command under """ if get_version() < 0.86: # This command wasn't introduced until 0.86 ceph return [] try: output = subprocess.check_output(["ceph", '--id', service, "fs", "ls"]) if not output: return [] """ Example subprocess output: 'name: ip-172-31-23-165, metadata pool: ip-172-31-23-165_metadata, data pools: [ip-172-31-23-165_data ]\n' output: filesystems: ['ip-172-31-23-165'] """ filesystems = [] for line in output.splitlines(): parts = line.split(',') for part in parts: if "name" in part: filesystems.append(part.split(' ')[1]) except subprocess.CalledProcessError: return []

commit_message:
Add sphinx extension to generate db diagram

The schemadisplay_sphinx module was included to automate the
creation of the current database diagram.  The image resulted from
the execution of tox -e docs is displayed in:

./doc/build/html/devref/db_layer.html

Depends-on: Ica3e5cc03e3978eb520f8e5863d92b93725c3331
Change-Id: I046fcff69d6de96d56c15da2b904fbc3d0775240
Closes-Bug: #1540525
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/74/274874/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'schemadisplay_sphinx',model_class_name = 'neutron.db.model_base.BASEV2' model_schema_filename = 'doc/source/devref/images/db-schema.png' model_skip_folders = ('.tox/,build/,releasenotes/,.eggs/,doc/,' 'tools/,rally-jobs/,neutron/tests/')

commit_message:
Updating dhcp allocation pool when subnet gateway ip is updated

when ever the subnet gateway ip is updated the dhcp allocation
pool should also updated
Closes-Bug : #1553968

commit_message:
Getting rid of bagpipe driver pointless dependency

The agent part of the bagpipe driver depends on
classes of networking_bagpipe_l2.
This patch gets rid of this dependency.
Some small refactoring of the bagpipe agent, and the bagpipe
mechanism driver are also done in this patch.

Change-Id: I87684ea56b6fc76b83958111eecef6832c4428ef
Closes-bug: #1452917

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import abc from oslo.config import cfg import six @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class BGPVPNAgentRpcCallBackMixin(object): """ Mix-in to support BGP VPN notifications in agent implementations. """ @abc.abstractmethod def create_bgpvpn_connection(self, context, bgpvpn_connection): """ Handle RPC fanout cast from service plugin to create a BGP VPN connection. """ pass @abc.abstractmethod def update_bgpvpn_connection(self, context, bgpvpn_connection): """ Handle RPC fanout cast from service plugin to update a BGP VPN connection. """ pass @abc.abstractmethod def delete_bgpvpn_connection(self, context, bgpvpn_connection): """ Handle RPC fanout cast from service plugin to delete a BGP VPN connection. """ pass def attach_port_on_bgpvpn_network(self, context, port_bgpvpn_info, host=None): """ Handle RPC cast from service plugin to attach port on BGP VPN network. """ if not host or host == cfg.CONF.host: self.bgpvpn_port_attach(context, port_bgpvpn_info) def detach_port_from_bgpvpn_network(self, context, port_bgpvpn_info, host=None): """ Handle RPC cast from service plugin to detach port from BGP VPN network. """ if not host or host == cfg.CONF.host: self.bgpvpn_port_detach(context, port_bgpvpn_info) @abc.abstractmethod def bgpvpn_port_attach(self, context, port_bgpvpn_info): pass @abc.abstractmethod def bgpvpn_port_detach(self, context, port_bgpvpn_info): pass

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 12:14:46.000000000', 'files': ['packaging/deb/package_deb.sh', 'packaging/rpm/package_rpm.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet/commit/9c545f7d04249b647996c14529b1ac79a3e8ba9f', 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I968f9ac33d37dcf8186734e8669d0b43c3389575
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I968f9ac33d37dcf8186734e8669d0b43c3389575
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/32/226732/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[WIP]Adds 2 rest apis for enabling and disabling arp on a given mac
Uses echo int_val >> /proc/sys/net/ipv4/conf/ethX/arp_ignore
to enable the arp response on a given interface
int_val = 0 for enable, 8 for disable
ethX = interface on which we need to disable arp

blueprint : active-active-spec

Change-Id: Ie72d00f72256057cfe9ad2a00a35fbb2c3f1711b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/81/249481/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging import os import socket import subprocess import flask import jinja2 import netifaces import pyroute2 from werkzeug import exceptions from octavia.amphorae.backends.agent.api_server import util from octavia.common import constants as consts LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def enable_or_disable(arp_ignore_val, mac_address): interface = _interface_by_mac(mac_address) cmd = "echo %d >> /proc/sys/net/ipv4/conf/%s/arp_ignore" % (arp_ignore_val, interface) try: subprocess.check_output(cmd, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, shell=True) except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: LOG.debug("Failed to disable/enable arp %s", e) raise exceptions.HTTPException( response=flask.make_response(flask.jsonify(dict( message='Error disabling/enabling arp', details=e.output)), 500)) return flask.make_response(flask.jsonify(dict( message="OK", details="Enabled/Disabled arp")), 202) def _interface_by_mac(mac): for interface in netifaces.interfaces(): if netifaces.AF_LINK in netifaces.ifaddresses(interface): for link in netifaces.ifaddresses(interface)[netifaces.AF_LINK]: if link.get('addr', '').lower() == mac.lower(): return interface raise exceptions.HTTPException( response=flask.make_response(flask.jsonify(dict( details="No suitable network interface found")), 404))

Populate entries in Mcast_Macs_Remote table

populate entries in the Mcast_Macs_Remote table.

added_lines: def bind_agent_host(ip_addr): """Bind agent service to host IP and restart the agent.""" try: amp_conf = util.CONF.haproxy_amphora.amphora_agent_config scmd = ("sed -i -r 's/bind_host = .*/bind_host = {host}/' " "{amp_conf}".format(host=ip_addr, amp_conf=amp_conf)) cmd = "/usr/sbin/service amphora-agent restart" subprocess.check_output(scmd.split(), stderr=subprocess.STDOUT) subprocess.check_output(cmd.split(), stderr=subprocess.STDOUT) except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: if 'Job is already running' not in e.output: LOG.debug("Failed to restart agent service: %(err)s", {'err': e}) return flask.make_response(flask.jsonify(dict( message="Error restarting agent service", details=e.output)), 500) return flask.make_response(flask.jsonify( dict(message='OK', details='Restarting agent service...')), 202)

commit_message:
update the lock with 'compare and update' plus retry

with_for_update() would fail in mysql galera backend, this patch add a
'compare and update' lock and a immediately retry logic. It reuse
the state column('processing' indicate the lock) and last_retried
timestamp.
And for neutron HA cases, to prevent the row in locking/'processing'
sleeping for a long time, add the lock release process in timer thread.

Change-Id: I38615a236eee62cc459c65e400114aa9808a1817

commit_message:
Refactor the process of getting ODL object in sync_all

Change-Id: I5858eccce96fb73f4386cdd1663a786537fb4e12
Closes-Bug: #1496249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/29/224029/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_serialization import jsonutils try: # Convert underscores to dashes in the URL for ODL collection_name_url = collection_name.replace('_', '-') urlpath = collection_name_url ret = self.client.sendjson('get', urlpath, None) except Exception: # Should retry later because can't get the resource this time # will continue sync other resource return False if ret.status_code != requests.codes.ok: return False odl_resources = jsonutils.loads(ret.text) # Find the resource in Neutron DB but not in ODL DB for resource in resources: matched = False for res in odl_resources[collection_name]: if resource['id'] == res['id']: matched = True break if not matched: filter_cls.filter_create_attributes_with_plugin( resource, plugin, dbcontext) to_be_synced.append(resource) return True ret = True ret &= self.sync_resources(plugin, dbcontext, collection_name) self.out_of_sync = ret
deleted_lines: for resource in resources: try: # Convert underscores to dashes in the URL for ODL collection_name_url = collection_name.replace('_', '-') urlpath = collection_name_url + '/' + resource['id'] self.client.sendjson('get', urlpath, None) except requests.exceptions.HTTPError as e: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() as ctx: if e.response.status_code == requests.codes.not_found: filter_cls.filter_create_attributes_with_plugin( resource, plugin, dbcontext) to_be_synced.append(resource) ctx.reraise = False else: # TODO(yamahata): compare result with resource. # If they don't match, update it below pass self.sync_resources(plugin, dbcontext, collection_name) self.out_of_sync = False

commit_message:
Remove ERROR_ON_CLONE references

It is *never* acceptable to manipulate this variable.  It defeats
devstack gate testing.

See also: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-September/075355.html

Depends-On: I9194069c4754439977a11404bbc5ac650c5134df
Change-Id: Ib09d66f355ab885d1f560a6d6577cec7bba412ad

commit_message:
Callback mechanism using Oslo Versioned Objects (PoC)

This is a PoC of modifying the callback mechanism to use Oslo
Versioned Objects. There are several things to note:

- Only implemented subscribe and notify methods in this PoC.
- Instead of using string for resource, use OVO class name.
- Provide param arg to notify, as some notifications provide additional
  info (e.g. context, id, old/new values). It can contain OVOs too.
- Added extra comments in tests, to describe the resources and tests.
- We don't have any OVOs ready yet, so you have to use your imagination
  a bit on how this can be used (or wait).

Change-Id: Ifaf9736d6c6480e52b0e2a0b036159c0dd4ae52e
Implements: blueprint neutron-lib

commit_message:
WIP DO NOT REVIEW): Implement MN API client fully

Remove dependency to midonetclient completely by implementing the
MidoNet API client code in the plugin.

Change-Id: I3767a95de36d7e233a1c155744dae3b918a96c84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/13/283713/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Midokura SARL, All Rights Reserved. # All Rights Reserved # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import base64 import httplib2 from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_serialization import jsonutils import socket import threading import urllib from webob import exc as wexc from midonet.neutron._i18n import _LE, _LI, _LW from midonet.neutron.common import exceptions as exc LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) _token = None _sem = threading.Semaphore(1) http_errors = dict((str(e.code), e) for e in wexc.HTTPClientError.__subclasses__() + wexc.HTTPServerError.__subclasses__()) def _is_http_error(status): """return True if http status is error or else False""" return True if int(status) > 300 else False def _from_json(content): """try to deserialize json string if not empty or else return raw input""" try: if content: return jsonutils.loads(content) except ValueError: LOG.warning(_LW("failed to jsonutils.loads() request content")) return content def do_request(url, method, body=None, query=None, headers=None): """Process a http rest request with input and output json strings. Sends json string serialized from body to url with verb method and returns a 2-tuple made of http response, and content deserialized into an object. """ LOG.debug("do_request: url=%s, method=%s" % (url, method)) LOG.debug("do_request: body=%s" % body) LOG.debug("do_request: headers=%s" % headers) if query: url += '?' + urllib.urlencode(query) data = jsonutils.dumps(body) if body is not None else '{}' headers = headers or dict() try: response, content = httplib2.Http().request(url, method, data, headers=headers) except socket.error as serr: if serr[1] == "ECONNREFUSED": raise exc.MidoApiConnectionRefused() raise LOG.debug("do_request: response=%s | content=%s" % (response, content)) if _is_http_error(response['status']): err = http_errors[response['status']](content) LOG.error(_LE("Got http error(response=%(res)s, content=%(con)s) for " "request(url=%(url)s, method=%(meth)s, body=%(body)s, " "query=%(query)s, headers=%(head)s): %(err)s"), {"res": response, "con": content, "url": url, "meth": method, "body": body, "query": query, "head": headers, "err": err}) raise err return response, _from_json(content) class HttpClient(object): def __init__(self, auth_url, username, password, project_id=None): self.auth_url = auth_url self.username = username self.password = password self.project_id = project_id def _login(self): """Login a user Make sure only one thread tries to login. The other threads would block until the first thread succeeds in setting the global _token variable. """ global _sem global _token if _sem.acquire(blocking=False): try: auth = base64.b64encode(self.username + ':' + self.password) headers = {'Authorization': 'Basic ' + auth} if self.project_id is not None: headers['X-Auth-Project'] = self.project_id LOG.info(_LI("Logging in to MidoNet API server")) resp, _body = do_request(self.auth_url, 'POST', body={}, headers=headers) set_cookie = resp['set-cookie'] session, sep, exp = set_cookie.partition(";") session_key, sep, _token = session.partition("=") finally: _sem.release() else: LOG.debug("Waiting for token to get reset") # Wait for another thread to set the token and release _sem.acquire(blocking=True) _sem.release() def _get_token(self, force=False): """Return the currently set token. Login the user if the global _token variable is not set. """ global _token if _token is None or force: self._login() return _token def _set_header_token(self, header, force=False): header['X-Auth-Token'] = self._get_token(force) def _do_request(self, url, method, body=None, query=None, headers=None): query = query or dict() headers = headers or dict() # Username will be None if user has opted to skip authorization. if self.username is not None: self._set_header_token(headers) try: return do_request(url, method, body=body, query=query, headers=headers) except wexc.HTTPUnauthorized: # Try one more time after logging in LOG.info(_LI("Got HTTPUnauthorized error, try logging in again")) self._set_header_token(headers, force=True) return do_request(url, method, body=body, query=query, headers=headers) def delete(self, url): return self._do_request(url, 'DELETE') def get(self, url, media_type, params=None): headers = {"Accept": media_type} return self._do_request(url, 'GET', query=params, headers=headers) def post(self, url, media_type, body=None, accept=None): if accept is None: accept = media_type headers = {"Content-Type": media_type, "Accept": accept} return self._do_request(url, 'POST', body=body, headers=headers) def put(self, url, media_type, body=None): headers = {"Content-Type": media_type} return self._do_request(url, 'PUT', body=body, headers=headers)

commit_message:
Adding network driver for a vip on a single amp

This network driver is designed to expose an amphora's IP that is on the
vip subnet as the load balancer's virtual ip.  This means this driver will
only work for single topology. It could work with some other topologies but
that is beyond the intent of this code.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I11816fb68296f305a7a5e767a7b9a7a87dc0864e
Closes-Bug: #1500593
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/58/197858/68 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: containers_driver = octavia.network.drivers.neutron.containers:ContainersDriver

subject: Adding the topology info at the time of LB AMP association
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 02:56:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/69b3db158b06ac504c7c32da273a43f6ad5537f6', 'message': "[WIP]Adding the topology info at the time of LB AMP association

This work adds the topology info into the AMPs amphora-agent.conf
at the time of LB AMP association, as we can't determine the
topology at the time of creation of the AMP.
In the details API the value of topology is harcoded. This
patch also fixes that

commit_message:
Adding the topology info at the time of LB AMP association

This work adds the topology info into the AMPs amphora-agent.conf
at the time of LB AMP association, as we can't determine the
topology at the time of creation of the AMP.
In the details API the value of topology is harcoded. This
patch also fixes that

Change-Id: I20a230726a1198d3b0ee685ca304f165d8f265f9
Closes-Bug:1534223

commit_message:
Add l3 vpn suport to neutron-dynamic-routing plugin

BGPVPN plugin will handle following event:
1. bgpvpn event: bgpvpn create/delete/update,
   bgpvpn associate/disassociate with router
2. router port create/delete event
3. subnetpool change address scope event
4. bgp speaker associate wth bgpvpn event

Co-Authored-By: henry.dong@cn.ibm.com

Change-Id: If0176bf20b4299ce0f5322ad3d2077bf6441b22b
Partial-Bug: #1509431

subject: WIP Allow setting values to None in portbindings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 19:48:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/portbindings_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/993f830886ce568610694004c4f7a4271bc89c81', 'message': 'WIP Allow setting values to None in portbindings

This came up while I was trying to test segments. My guess is that no
one hits this because ML2 has its own port binding implementation.
But, many of my segments unit tests run against this one. So, I
thought it'd be good to get it right.

validators.is_attr_set is often mistaken for meaning "user didn't
supply a value." It doesn't mean that! In this context, comparing to
ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED is a clearer, and more correct, way to express
that. For binding profile, and binding_vnic, it was taken care of by
checking is not None. However, for host, the code doesn't distinguish
between not set and None.

Change-Id: I663183c167c84811f67cd1d7c7e5e5ccb5d96f52
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Allow setting values to None in portbindings

This came up while I was trying to test segments. My guess is that no
one hits this because ML2 has its own port binding implementation.
But, many of my segments unit tests run against this one. So, I
thought it'd be good to get it right.

validators.is_attr_set is often mistaken for meaning "user didn't
supply a value." It doesn't mean that! In this context, comparing to
ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED is a clearer, and more correct, way to express
that. For binding profile, and binding_vnic, it was taken care of by
checking is not None. However, for host, the code doesn't distinguish
between not set and None.

Change-Id: I663183c167c84811f67cd1d7c7e5e5ccb5d96f52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/19/346219/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib import constants binding_profile_set = binding_profile != constants.ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED if not binding_profile_set: binding_vnic_set = binding_vnic != constants.ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED if not binding_vnic_set: host_set = host != constants.ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED if host: if not bind_port: context.session.add(PortBindingPort(port_id=port['id'], host=host)) else: bind_port.host = host elif bind_port: context.session.delete(bind_port)
deleted_lines: from neutron_lib.api import validators binding_profile_set = validators.is_attr_set(binding_profile) if not binding_profile_set and binding_profile is not None: binding_vnic_set = validators.is_attr_set(binding_vnic) if not binding_vnic_set and binding_vnic is not None: host_set = validators.is_attr_set(host) if not bind_port: context.session.add(PortBindingPort(port_id=port['id'], host=host)) else: bind_port.host = host

commit_message:
Add generic object AMQP notifier

Adds a notifier that listens for events using the callback system.
It reacts to these events to put the latest state of objects onto
the message bus.

This currently puts the dict result of a plugin 'get' call but it
will be replaced by oslo versioned objects as payloads when they
ready.

Change-Id: I44b690d188f47cc336df3484e65abbfa81fa1eca
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/30/336730/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.api.rpc.agentnotifiers import object_dispatch n = object_dispatch.ObjectChangeNotifier() n.register_resource_callbacks() self.agent_notifiers[object_dispatch.RPC_TOPIC] = n

commit_message:
Add generic object AMQP receiver

Adds a receiver side to the generic AMQP notifier added in
I44b690d188f47cc336df3484e65abbfa81fa1eca.

Agents can load this and subscribe to the resource types they
are interested in. This component will handle the logic of
discarding update ordering resolution and storing the bodies
for objects. It will convert these into callbacks for the
resource types that things can subscribe to as necessary.

Change-Id: I70e291b619559645ac3380950b2c7adccde885e2
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications

added_lines: import collections import time import eventletfrom neutron._i18n import _LE class AgentObjectDatastore(object): """Agent-side of the generic AMQP object transmitter.""" def __init__(self): self.target = oslo_messaging.Target(version='1.0', namespace=RPC_NAMESPACE_OBJECTS) self._conn = n_rpc.create_connection() self._data_caches_by_type = collections.defaultdict(dict) self._process_queue = set() def listen_for_object_changes(self, object_type): topic = topics.get_topic_name(RPC_TOPIC, object_type, 'change') self._conn.create_consumer(topic, [self]) def start_listening(self): self._conn.consume_in_threads() eventlet.spawn(self._local_callback_loop) def get_object_body(self, object_type, object_id): t_cache = self._data_caches_by_type[object_type] if object_id not in t_cache: raise RuntimeError("no such object") return t_cache[object_id] def _local_callback_loop(self): """Drains items from the change queue and generates callback events.""" while True: bad_things = set() while self._process_queue: try: otype, oid = self._process_queue.pop() body = self.get_object_body(otype, oid) if not body: registry.notify(otype, events.AFTER_DELETE, self, object_id=oid) else: registry.notify(otype, events.AFTER_UPDATE, self, object_id=oid, object_body=body) except Exception: LOG.exception("Exeption encountered draining process queue") bad_things.add((otype, oid)) self._process_queue.update(bad_things) time.sleep(0.5) def object_change(self, context, object_type, object_id, payload, *args, **kwargs): t_cache = self._data_caches_by_type[object_type] if object_id not in t_cache: t_cache[object_id] = payload LOG.debug("%(ot)s %(oid)s was added to cache", dict(ot=object_type, oid=object_id)) elif payload is None: # deleted t_cache[object_id] = None LOG.debug("%(ot)s %(oid)s was deleted", dict(ot=object_type, oid=object_id)) elif t_cache[object_id] is None: LOG.debug("Received stale update for deleted %(ot)s %(oid)s", dict(ot=object_type, oid=object_id)) return else: logarg = dict(ot=object_type, oid=object_id, lr=t_cache[object_id]['revision'], pr=payload['revision']) if t_cache[object_id]['revision'] > payload['revision']: LOG.debug("Received out of order update for %(ot)s %(oid)s, " "cache revision %(lr)s, received revision %(pr)s.", logarg) return elif t_cache[object_id]['revision'] == payload['revision']: LOG.debug("Received duplicate update for %(ot)s %(oid)s, " "cache revision %(lr)s, received revision %(pr)s.", logarg) return else: LOG.debug("Updated datastore for %(ot)s %(oid)s from " "revision %(lr)s to revision %(pr)s.", logarg) t_cache[object_id] = payload self._process_queue.add((object_type, object_id))
