commit_message:
Add neutron-dynamic-routing driver

This driver will notify neutron-dyanmic-routing plugin
with following evnent:
1. bgpvpn create/delete/update event
2. bgpvpn-router-assoc create/delete event.

Co-Authored-By: henry.dong@cn.ibm.com

Change-Id: I1c2ec450708dad6113d6ddb7014a17d0a29f3ae4
Partial-Bug: #1509431
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/00/340800/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 IBM. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy import mock import webob.exc from neutron.callbacks import events from neutron.callbacks import registry from networking_bgpvpn.neutron.callback import resources from networking_bgpvpn.tests.unit.services import test_plugin class TestBgpvpnDRCommon(test_plugin.BgpvpnTestCaseMixin): def setUp(self): provider = ('networking_bgpvpn.neutron.services.service_drivers.' 'neutron_dynamic_routing.dr.DynamicRoutingBGPVPNDriver') super(TestBgpvpnDRCommon, self).setUp(service_provider=provider) self.create_callback = mock.Mock() self.update_callback = mock.Mock() self.delete_callback = mock.Mock() self.router_create_callback = mock.Mock() self.router_delete_callback = mock.Mock() registry.subscribe(self.create_callback, resources.BGPVPN, events.AFTER_CREATE) registry.subscribe(self.update_callback, resources.BGPVPN, events.AFTER_UPDATE) registry.subscribe(self.delete_callback, resources.BGPVPN, events.AFTER_DELETE) registry.subscribe(self.router_create_callback, resources.BGPVPN_ROUTER_ASSOC, events.AFTER_CREATE) registry.subscribe(self.router_delete_callback, resources.BGPVPN_ROUTER_ASSOC, events.AFTER_DELETE) class TestDRServiceDriver(TestBgpvpnDRCommon): def test_create_bgpvpn_with_empty_rd_dr(self): bgpvpn_data = copy.copy(self.bgpvpn_data['bgpvpn']) bgpvpn_data.update({"route_distinguishers": ""}) # Assert that an error is returned to the client bgpvpn_req = self.new_create_request( 'bgpvpn/bgpvpns', bgpvpn_data) res = bgpvpn_req.get_response(self.ext_api) self.assertEqual(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest.code, res.status_int) def test_create_bgpvpn_with_empty_vni_dr(self): bgpvpn_data = copy.copy(self.bgpvpn_data['bgpvpn']) bgpvpn_data.update({"vni": ""}) # Assert that an error is returned to the client bgpvpn_req = self.new_create_request( 'bgpvpn/bgpvpns', bgpvpn_data) res = bgpvpn_req.get_response(self.ext_api) self.assertEqual(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest.code, res.status_int) def test_create_bgpvpn(self): with self.bgpvpn(do_delete=False) as bgpvpn: self.create_callback.assert_called_once_with( resources.BGPVPN, events.AFTER_CREATE, mock.ANY, name=bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['name'], id=bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'], context=mock.ANY, type=bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['type'], rd=bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['route_distinguishers'], vni=bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['vni'], import_rt=bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['route_targets'] + bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['import_targets'], export_rt=bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['route_targets'] + bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['export_targets']) def test_update_bgpvpn_with_new_rd(self): with self.bgpvpn(do_delete=False) as bgpvpn: new_data = {"bgpvpn": {"route_distinguishers": "100:300"}} # Assert that an error is returned to the client self._update('bgpvpn/bgpvpns', bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'], new_data, expected_code=webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest.code) def test_update_bgpvpn_with_new_vni(self): with self.bgpvpn(do_delete=False) as bgpvpn: new_data = {"bgpvpn": {"vni": "2000"}} # Assert that an error is returned to the client self._update('bgpvpn/bgpvpns', bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'], new_data, expected_code=webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest.code) def test_update_bgpvpn(self): with self.bgpvpn(do_delete=False) as bgpvpn: update_data = {"bgpvpn": {"name": "foo"}} self._update('bgpvpn/bgpvpns', bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'], update_data) new_vpn = {'id': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'], 'name': 'foo', 'type': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['type'], 'rd': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['route_distinguishers'], 'vni': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['vni'], 'export_rt': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['route_targets'] + bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['export_targets'], 'import_rt': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['route_targets'] + bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['import_targets']} old_vpn = {'id': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'], 'name': 'bgpvpn1', 'type': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['type'], 'rd': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['route_distinguishers'], 'vni': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['vni'], 'export_rt': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['route_targets'] + bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['export_targets'], 'import_rt': bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['route_targets'] + bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['import_targets']} self.update_callback.assert_called_once_with( resources.BGPVPN, events.AFTER_UPDATE, mock.ANY, context=mock.ANY, new_vpn=new_vpn, old_vpn=old_vpn) def test_delete_bgpvpn(self): with self.bgpvpn(do_delete=False) as bgpvpn: self._delete('bgpvpn/bgpvpns', bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id']) self.delete_callback.assert_called_once_with( resources.BGPVPN, events.AFTER_DELETE, mock.ANY, id=bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'], name=bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['name'], context=mock.ANY) def test_create_bgpvpn_router_assoc(self): with self.bgpvpn() as bgpvpn, \ self.router(tenant_id=self._tenant_id) as router: with self.assoc_router(bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'], router['router']['id'], do_disassociate=False): self.router_create_callback.assert_called_once_with( resources.BGPVPN_ROUTER_ASSOC, events.AFTER_CREATE, mock.ANY, context=mock.ANY, bgpvpn_id=bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'], router_id=router['router']['id']) def test_delete_bgpvpn_router_assoc(self): with self.bgpvpn() as bgpvpn, \ self.router(tenant_id=self._tenant_id) as router: with self.assoc_router(bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'], router['router']['id'], do_disassociate=False) as assoc: assoc_id = assoc['router_association']['id'] res = 'bgpvpn/bgpvpns/' + bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'] + \ '/router_associations' self._delete(res, assoc_id) self.router_delete_callback.assert_called_once_with( resources.BGPVPN_ROUTER_ASSOC, events.AFTER_DELETE, mock.ANY, context=mock.ANY, bgpvpn_id=bgpvpn['bgpvpn']['id'], router_id=router['router']['id'])

added_lines: class L3AgentAZLeastRoutersSchedulerDvrSnatTestCase( L3AgentAZLeastRoutersSchedulerTestCase): def _register_l3_agents(self): self.agent1 = helpers.register_l3_agent(host='az1-host1', az='az1', agent_mode=constants.L3_AGENT_MODE_DVR_SNAT) self.agent2 = helpers.register_l3_agent(host='az1-host2', az='az1', agent_mode=constants.L3_AGENT_MODE_DVR_SNAT) self.agent3 = helpers.register_l3_agent(host='az2-host1', az='az2', agent_mode=constants.L3_AGENT_MODE_DVR_SNAT) self.agent4 = helpers.register_l3_agent(host='az2-host2', az='az2', agent_mode=constants.L3_AGENT_MODE_DVR_SNAT) self.agent5 = helpers.register_l3_agent(host='az3-host1', az='az3', agent_mode=constants.L3_AGENT_MODE_DVR_SNAT) self.agent6 = helpers.register_l3_agent(host='az3-host2', az='az3', agent_mode=constants.L3_AGENT_MODE_DVR_SNAT) def _create_ha_router(self, ha=True, tenant_id='tenant1', az_hints=None): r = (super(L3AgentAZLeastRoutersSchedulerDvrSnatTestCase, self). _create_ha_router(ha=ha, az_hints=az_hints)) r['distributed'] = True return r

subject: Fix inappropriate info when net-list -F {fields}
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-14 10:29:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/f6da4d911fbe00d1fa5245006671c862af4f3563', 'message': "Fix return inappropriate message when run net-list -F {fields}

Run neutron net-list -F ${which not contained fields},it will return
some inappropriate info, the expected is return nothing.

In this view, the result from neutron-server is like ['network':[{},{}]],
So the logic just treat it as not None.This patch fix that when the result
like [{},{}], it will set the result to [].

commit_message:
Fix inappropriate info when net-list -F {fields}

Run neutron net-list -F ${which not contained fields}, it will return
some inappropriate info, the expected from neutronclient is throwing
error. In this view, the result from neutron-server is just like
['network':[{},{}]], So the logic should throw an exception.
This patch fix that when the result like [{},{}], it will raise
InvalidResult exception.

Closes-Bug: #1489678
Change-Id: I23b3d3a9e9728cf946df37bfdcaefa875beb1e84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/79/213079/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if isinstance([], info): # check the info whether is like [{},{}] which means no result. # So will set info to []. count = info.count() i = 0 for mes in info: if not mes: i += 1 if count == i: info = []

subject: Remove mox in files test_cli20_address_scope.py and test_cli20_port.py

commit_message:
DNM - Devstack refactor patch

This commit attempts to use the new lib/neutron in DevStack and test all
existing Neutron CI jobs with it.

Grenade change

No-wait patch
Depends-On: I271dc8b6ae5487c80d2a22153b3fc45fb247707f

Change-Id: I33ffc84bda37def1f794ad85284ec67be9007084

commit_message:
[WIP] Service driver base and dispatcher

Change-Id: Iaa400fb3451894341004d4f026c0638c00ce2a80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/21/351821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import abc from oslo_log import log as logging import six from neutron._i18n import _, _LI from neutron.common import utils LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class ServiceDriverBase(object): """Base Service Driver interface, from a service plugin to backend.""" @abc.abstractmethod def get_description(): pass class ServiceDriverDispatcher(object): """This class servers as a dispatcher to multiple backend drivers.""" def __init__(self, driver_interface, service): self._drivers = [] self._service = service self._driver_interface = driver_interface if not issubclass(driver_interface, ServiceDriverBase): AttributeError(_("Driver interface %(driver_interface)s must " "be a subclass of ServiceDriver, but it's not", {'driver_interface': driver_interface})) def __getattr__(self, attrib): try: method = object.__getattribute__(self._driver_interface, attrib) if not hasattr(method, '__call__'): raise AttributeError() except AttributeError: raise AttributeError(_("Driver interface %(driver_interface)s has " "no method %(method_name)s", {'driver_interface': self._driver_interface, 'method_name': attrib})) def _dispatcher_method(method_name, *args, **kwargs): for driver in self._drivers: getattr(driver, method_name)(*args, **kwargs) return _dispatcher_method(attrib) def check_loaded_drivers(self): """Makes sure there's at least one driver loaded.""" if not self._drivers: raise SystemExit(_("At least one driver for service %(service)s " "must be loaded", self._service)) def load_driver(self, driver_name, namespace): """Adds an instance of a service driver to the dispatcher.""" driver = utils.load_class_by_alias_or_classname(namespace, driver_name) driver_instance = driver() LOG.info( _LI("Loading %(name)s (%(description)s) driver " "for %(service)s service"), {"name": driver_name, "description": driver_instance.get_description(), "service": self._service}) self._drivers.append(driver_instance)

commit_message:
WIP:Support for getting peer speaker status

This patch add 2 API for getting peer and speaker status.
Uts is not complete.

Closes-Bug: #1527993
Change-Id: I1b0d93c09d17ab631dd171c7f7de8dda70cbc33d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing refs/changes/97/334397/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_bgp_speaker_status(self, context, payload): bgp_speaker_id = payload['bgp_speaker']['id'] speaker_as = payload['bgp_speaker']['speaker_as'] result = self.dr_driver_cls.get_bgp_speaker_statistics(speaker_as) LOG.debug('Get BGP Speaker %(bgp_speaker_id)s statistics %(result)s', {'bgp_speaker_id': bgp_speaker_id, 'result': result}) return result def get_bgp_peer_status(self, context, payload): bgp_speaker_id = payload['bgp_speaker']['id'] speaker_as = payload['bgp_speaker']['speaker_as'] peer_ip = payload['bgp_speaker']['peer'] result = self.dr_driver_cls.get_bgp_peer_statistics(speaker_as, peer_ip) LOG.debug('Get BGP Peer %(peer_ip)s statistics serviced by BGP Speaker' '%(bgp_speaker_id)s %(result)s', {'peer_ip': peer_ip, 'bgp_speaker_id': bgp_speaker_id, 'result': result}) return result

The patch refers http://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/655463/ in OVN,
which one will try to extend current Address_Set table to Set table.
Set table is a more common, than only address set, it can also accept
string values as set member.

For networking-ovn, using port-name set under Set table with ACLs will
change the way we generate ACL entries for Neutron security groups.

Before this patch, we create ACL entries per each port, such a ACL entry
will have "inport == NEUTRON_PORT_ID" or "outport == NEUTRON_PORT_ID" in
its match field. So the number of ACL entries we need to create, is in
direct proportion to ports number and SG rules number.

After this patch, we will create ACL entries per each SG rule, and port
set will tell which ports are using a SG rule. So we will have ACL entry
like:
match: "inport == $sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID" or "outport == $sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID".
The "sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID" will be a port set name, and in that set, there
are all port names(Neutron port ids), which belongs to ports are binding
to a SG rule. It tries to make number of ACL entris only be direct proportion
to SG rules number.

Since ACL entry is defined closer to a SG rule than a port, so ACL exteral_ids
will be changed to use SG rule id.

TODO:
 - fix ACL entries for non-native DHCP supporting
 - fix sg_net_mapping for delete port and port disassociate SG case
 - update for reuse ACL entries if it can get support in OVN
 - update tests.

Change-Id: Ib1e46192b987289da0729e91f5ec6e16dab4b53e

commit_message:
WIP align address_set to set and use port sets

The patch refers http://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/655463/ in OVN,
which one will try to extend current Address_Set table to Set table.
Set table is a more common, than only address set, it can also accept
string values as set member.

For networking-ovn, using port-name set under Set table with ACLs will
change the way we generate ACL entries for Neutron security groups.

Before this patch, we create ACL entries per each port, such a ACL entry
will have "inport == NEUTRON_PORT_ID" or "outport == NEUTRON_PORT_ID" in
its match field. So the number of ACL entries we need to create, is in
direct proportion to ports number and SG rules number.

After this patch, we will create ACL entries per each SG rule, and port
set will tell which ports are using a SG rule. So we will have ACL entry
like:
match: "inport == $sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID" or "outport == $sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID".
The "sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID" will be a port set name, and in that set, there
are all port names(Neutron port ids), which belongs to ports are binding
to a SG rule. It tries to make number of ACL entris only be direct proportion
to SG rules number.

Since ACL entry is defined closer to a SG rule than a port, so ACL exteral_ids
will be changed to use SG rule id.

TODO:
 - fix ACL entries for non-native DHCP supporting
 - fix sg_net_mapping for delete port and port disassociate SG case
 - update for reuse ACL entries if it can get support in OVN
 - update tests.

Change-Id: Ib1e46192b987289da0729e91f5ec6e16dab4b53e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/97/352697/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_acls_dict_for_sg_rules(sg_rules): dir_map = { 'ingress': 'to-lport', 'egress': 'from-lport', } dp_map = { 'ingress': 'outport', 'egress': 'inport', } ret = {} for r in sg_rules: # Update the match based on which direction this rule is for (ingress # or egress). match = '%s == $%s' % ( dp_map[r['direction']], utils.ovn_portset_name(r['security_group_id'])) # Update the match for IPv4 vs IPv6. ip_match, ip_version, icmp = acl_ethertype(r) match += ip_match # Update the match if an IPv4 or IPv6 prefix was specified. match += acl_remote_ip_prefix(r, ip_version) # Update the match if remote group id was specified. match += acl_remote_group_id(r, ip_version) # Update the match for the protocol (tcp, udp, icmp) and port/type # range if specified. match += acl_protocol_and_ports(r, icmp) ret[r['id']] = { "priority": ovn_const.ACL_PRIORITY_ALLOW, "action": ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_ALLOW_RELATED, "log": False, "direction": dir_map[r['direction']], "match": match, "external_ids": {ovn_const.OVN_SG_RULE_EXT_ID_KEY: r['id']}} return ret def create_drop_acls_dict_for_sgs(sg_ids): ret = {} # Drop all IP traffic to and from the logical port by default. for direction, p in (('from-lport', 'inport'), ('to-lport', 'outport')): for sg_id in sg_ids: ext_id = '%s-drop' % sg_id ret[ext_id] = { "priority": ovn_const.ACL_PRIORITY_DROP, "action": ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_DROP, "log": False, "direction": direction, "match": '%s == $%s && ip' % ( p, utils.ovn_portset_name(sg_id)), "external_ids": { ovn_const.OVN_SG_RULE_EXT_ID_KEY: ext_id} } return ret def create_acls_dict(sg_rules): sg_ids = set() for r in sg_rules: sg_ids.add(r['security_group_id']) ret = create_acls_dict_for_sg_rules(sg_rules) ret.update(create_drop_acls_dict_for_sgs(sg_ids)) return ret def format_acl_key(acl): key_action = { ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_DROP: 1, ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_ALLOW: 2, ovn_const.ACL_ACTION_ALLOW_RELATED: 3}.get(acl['action'], 0) key_priority = { ovn_const.ACL_PRIORITY_ALLOW: 4, ovn_const.ACL_PRIORITY_DROP: 8}.get(acl['priority'], 0) key_direction = {'from-lport': 16, 'to-lport': 32}.get(acl['direction'], 0) key_apd = key_action | key_priority | key_direction return '%d-%s' % (key_apd, acl['match'])

commit_message:
delete conntrack entries properly

This patch prevents unintentional consumption of
devices_with_updated_sg_members.
Also note that this patch make
_clean_deleted_remote_sg_members_conntrack_entries method
consistent with ohter brother methods(
_clean_deleted_sg_rule_conntrack_entries and
_clean_updated_sg_member_conntrack_entries).

Change-Id: Ic448ceb8832a5b874c92f6da17b65dbda26b98dd
Closes-Bug: #1580377

commit_message:
Make subnet_id for lbaas v2 member create optional

Presently subnet_id is required for creating lbaas v2 member.
This patch makes subnet_id optional for creating the member.
If subnet id is not specified, then load balancer vip subnet_id is used.

Change-Id: I658b0fc57b14d590d502600ccda9a52582658786
Closes-bug: #1426248
Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Angus Lees <gus@inodes.org>

commit_message:
WIP align Address_Set to Set

This WIP patch is tracing [1], which one will try to rename table Address_Set
to Set in OVN NB DB.

[1] http://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/657589/.

commit_message:
Transition to new oslo_db test fixtures

WIP - this is experimental as I get the oslo.db
API to work well for several consuming projects
simultaneously

This links to the non-merged version of oslo.db at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/345601/6 .  Uses a
shell script within tox test commands in order to
run all tests against in-progress version of oslo.db

Change-Id: I10b648412445de0fc199a4021590c683dddd16cc

Fix help msg of IP_Version in address-scope-create

Add 'choose from 4 or 6' to the help msg of IP_VERSION of
'address-scope-create' for more clarity.

Closes-Bug: #1593130

commit_message:
GATE/GRENADE TESTING DO NOT MERGE

Deprecate nova_metadata_ip and changed to nova_metadata_host

nova_metadata_ip implies that this variable must be an
ip address. nova_metadata_ip can be either an IP or a hostname

When using a TLS encrypted session using anything other than a
hostname will result in an SSL issue. The help documentation
for this variable has also been modified to specify that if
a TLS encypted session is running this must be a hostname.

nova_metadata_host is now a MutliStringOpt, with a
deprecated name of nova_metadata_ip, and help is updated
to reflect the requirements.

Change-Id: If51ec7219481395ab19f59df6dc1557f420f6020
Closes-bug:#1585699

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: check if tests run with different random seed

Tests are usually forked and exec()d rather than python's fork
function, but that seem to depend on test settings.
Let's confirm that by confirming every assertEqual fails with a
different value.

Change-Id: I857174c149b0be3297c676b0749c9c8d4c2912d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/08/353308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self.environment = environment self.environment.test_name = self.get_name() self.useFixture(self.environment) self.client = self.environment.neutron_server.client self.safe_client = self.useFixture( client_resource.ClientFixture(self.client))

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-20 07:39:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b051325051380f17e58cede55ca17ef864bd665a', 'message': 'Update update_port policy for network owner

Previous policy.json has rules:
  "update_port": "rule:admin_or_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc",
and:
  "update_port:fixed_ips": "rule:admin_or_network_owner or
rule:context_is_advsvc"
the port attribute rule will be "blocked" by root rule.

With rbac, after tenant-A gives tenant-B access_as_shared privilege,
tenant-B user can create a port(port-B) on tenant-A network net-A.
Later, as network owner, tenant-A user may have some plans to update
fixed_ip for port-B. But tenant-A user will fail to do that, and get
"The resource could not be found." return message, for policy check
not pass on root rule for "update_port".

Not only to fixed_ips, there are some other attributes also be blocked
now. Such as mac_address, device_owner, etc.

This patch chooses using "admin_owner_or_network_owner" to replace
"admin_or_network_owner" to fix this.

Attention, even tenant-B is owner of port-B, we shouldn't give privilige
for tenant-B to update attribute like fixed_ips for port-B on net-A.
For tenant-B cannot only get ports not belong to tenant-B on net-A, so
give tenant-B privilege to update fixed_ips will cause unnecessary IP
conflict trouble. So it should be safe to keep current rule for port
attributes on update action.

Change-Id: I57d2628128b9bc7168db77df04502573434714f9
Closes-Bug: #1534954

commit_message:
access-control: Allow network owner to update port

Previous policy.json has rules:
  "update_port": "rule:admin_or_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc",
and:
  "update_port:fixed_ips": "rule:admin_or_network_owner or
rule:context_is_advsvc"
the port attribute rule will be "blocked" by root rule.

With rbac, after tenant-A gives tenant-B access_as_shared privilege,
tenant-B user can create a port(port-B) on tenant-A network net-A.
Later, as network owner, tenant-A user may have some plans to update
fixed_ip for port-B. But tenant-A user will fail to do that, and get
"The resource could not be found." return message, for policy check
not pass on root rule for "update_port".

Not only to fixed_ips, there are some other attributes also be blocked
now. Such as mac_address, device_owner, etc.

This patch chooses using "admin_owner_or_network_owner" to replace
"admin_or_network_owner" to fix this.

Attention, even tenant-B is owner of port-B, we shouldn't give privilige
for tenant-B to update attribute like fixed_ips for port-B on net-A.
For tenant-B cannot only get ports not belong to tenant-B on net-A, so
give tenant-B privilege to update fixed_ips will cause unnecessary IP
conflict trouble. So it should be safe to keep current rule for port
attributes on update action.

Change-Id: I57d2628128b9bc7168db77df04502573434714f9
Closes-Bug: #1534954
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/77/268677/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "update_port:device_owner": "not rule:network_device or rule:admin_or_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc", "update_port:fixed_ips": "rule:admin_or_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc", "update_port:port_security_enabled": "rule:admin_or_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc", "update_port:mac_learning_enabled": "rule:admin_or_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc", "update_port:allowed_address_pairs": "rule:admin_or_owner",
deleted_lines: "update_port:device_owner": "not rule:network_device or rule:admin_or_network_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc", "update_port:fixed_ips": "rule:admin_or_network_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc", "update_port:port_security_enabled": "rule:admin_or_network_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc", "update_port:mac_learning_enabled": "rule:admin_or_network_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc", "update_port:allowed_address_pairs": "rule:admin_or_network_owner",

subject: [l2pop] add timestamp to fdb to avoid concurrency
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 14:57:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/rpc.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/driver_context.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/rpc_manager/l2population_rpc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8b052a045a1c67551b378fbc941275b514dcf51b', 'message': "[l2pop] add timestamp to fdb to avoid concurrency

Port binding and status updates of a port can occur simultaneously
during migration and l2pop notifies agents for each update through RPC.
1) But these RPC calls can reach the agent at different times.
2) If they reach the agent in correct order also, agent's handlers
   might be simultaneously processing them
Because of 1) and 2) stale ovs flows might be added by agent for a port

To force synchronization, we add timestamp to PortContext during
port binding and status updates. This timestamp is passed as part of
fdb along with port.

When agent receives multiple fdbs for same port, it uses lock to
synchronize them and then fdb with latest timestamp will setup flows.
Agent also maintains dict of these port fdb(with latest timestamp).

Need work on compatibility with previous releases and
linux bridge agent changes.

Co-Authored-By: Hong Hui Xiao <honghui_xiao@yeah.net>
Related-Bug: #1611308
Change-Id: Idc3c72b657ba607a0e18b78a894ef7981ad61202
"}]
commit_message:
[l2pop] add timestamp to fdb to avoid concurrency

Port binding and status updates of a port can occur simultaneously
during migration and l2pop notifies agents for each update through RPC.
1) But these RPC calls can reach the agent at different times.
2) If they reach the agent in correct order also, agent's handlers
   might be simultaneously processing them
Because of 1) and 2) stale ovs flows might be added by agent for a port

To force synchronization, we add timestamp to PortContext during
port binding and status updates. This timestamp is passed as part of
fdb along with port.

When agent receives multiple fdbs for same port, it uses lock to
synchronize them and then fdb with latest timestamp will setup flows.
Agent also maintains dict of these port fdb(with latest timestamp).

Need work on compatibility with previous releases and
linux bridge agent changes.

Co-Authored-By: Hong Hui Xiao <honghui_xiao@yeah.net>
Related-Bug: #1611308
Change-Id: Idc3c72b657ba607a0e18b78a894ef7981ad61202
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/50/353550/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pi_length = len(l2pop_rpc.PortInfo._fields) (address, [l2pop_rpc.PortInfo((*pi)[:pi_length]) for pi in port_infos]) if port_id in port._fields: with lockutils.lock(port_id, lock_file_prefix='neutron-add-fdb', external=True): fdb_port = self.fdb_ports.get(port_id) if fdb_port and fdb_port.timestamp > port.timestamp: return self.fdb_ports[port_id] = port self.add_fdb_flow(br, port, remote_ip, lvm, ofport) else: self.add_fdb_flow(br, port, remote_ip, lvm, ofport)
deleted_lines: (address, [l2pop_rpc.PortInfo(*pi) for pi in port_infos]) self.add_fdb_flow(br, port, remote_ip, lvm, ofport)

commit_message:
Add pause after reload_cfg

HUP signals handle asynchronously, which causes conflicts when multiple
signals are sent.

This change adds small pause after sending HUP signal.

Change-Id: I65be6f6365ec56696dedb5e7a538c33db1854f13
Closes-bug: #1598078

commit_message:
fullstack test for vm migration

Adding a new fullstack test for vm migration.
vm will created first on one host and tested for conectivity.
Then it will be migrated to another host and again we check for
vm connectivity.

Change-Id: I74ed96f00d3f0faf66b78c26fc4e6ab096fc13c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/90/299290/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return vms class TestVmMigration(BaseConnectivitySameNetworkTest): # Need to enhance test for other network types l2_agent_type = constants.AGENT_TYPE_OVS network_scenarios = [ ('VXLAN', {'network_type': 'vxlan', 'l2_pop': True})] interface_scenarios = [ ('openflow-cli', {'of_interface': 'ovs-ofctl', 'ovsdb_interface': 'vsctl'})] scenarios = testscenarios.multiply_scenarios( network_scenarios, interface_scenarios) def test_vm_migration(self): vms = self._test_connectivity() # migrate vm from host 0 to host 1 and then test connectivity. vms[0].migrate_to_host(self.environment.hosts[1]) vms[0].block_until_boot() vms[0].block_until_ping(vms[2].ip)

commit_message:
base API v2: enrich *.delete.end notify payload

When Neutron emits notification for objects like subnet, port, router and
network being deleted, the notification payload only contain the id of the
entity being deleted.
Ceilometer needs the same amount of metadata sent for the *.create.end events,
for the *.delete.end events too.

Change-Id: Ib5d0c176eca2c3cceb23d3553bc24ffb31b7c555
Closes-Bug: 1543379

subject: [WIP] Exit and log an error when vxlan_group is incorrectly set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-30 17:24:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9ea4ecbaa1eff0873efa6f41c6f4f9729f6dc6e9', 'message': "[WIP] Exit and log an error when vxlan_group is incorrectly set

OpenStack-Ansible was configuring vxlan_group as:

vxlan_group =

Which would throw a warning in the neutron linuxbridge agent logs,
but wouldn't stop the agent. It would however fail to bind instances and
cause lots of other problems. Now, we'll exit hard when this situation
happens to draw attention to the operator that something is wrong.

Change-Id: I87c75986b479400cddcc6c52b58b7e2ad47b3275
Closes-Bug: #1521793

commit_message:
[WIP] Exit and log an error when vxlan_group is incorrectly set

OpenStack-Ansible was configuring[1] vxlan_group as:

vxlan_group = ''

Which would throw a warning in the neutron linuxbridge agent logs,
but wouldn't stop the agent. It would however fail to bind instances and
cause lots of other problems. Now, we'll exit hard when this situation
happens to draw attention to the operator that something is wrong.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252100/5/playbooks/roles/os_neutron/defaults/main.yml

Change-Id: I87c75986b479400cddcc6c52b58b7e2ad47b3275
Closes-Bug: #1521793
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/28/336128/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: LOG.warning(_LW('VXLAN muticast group(s) must be provided in ' 'vxlan_group option to enable VXLAN MCAST mode')) return False

commit_message:
Remove useless JSON blob from debug logs

This commit removes logging the entire json blob of routers on a
success request. This is completely unecessary and when lots of
router creations come in they just add noise to the logs for no
benefit.

Change-Id: Id8e138dce414e9b5468a6aa3011b330443d22c4f

commit_message:
Update nova api 2.0 to 2.1

Nova team decided to abandon the 2.0 api, so we should update the version
to 2.1.
And the nova patch had merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311653/

we should bump to use v2.1 ASAP

Change-Id: Icb606973467b2ac3ee722daa6cbce3007b6bc342
Closes-Bug: #1588171

commit_message:
Delete net throughly though it has admin's subnet

After a tenant creates a network and admin creates a subnet,
just like the scenario appended at the test_plugin.py,
dead loop will be happen while deleting the network.
This patch set fix this bug by nuking the network and its subnets
throughly whatever its subnets belong to its tenant or not.

Change-Id: I43e865d07687152da993f62696d13d7bfad01017
Closes-Bug: #1588228

added_lines: net_tenant_id = self._get_network(context, id)['tenant_id'] for subnet in subnets: if subnet.tenant_id != net_tenant_id: raise exc.ObjectNotFound(id=subnet.id)

commit_message:
Add some arguments of the command "quota-update"

There are some arguments should be added to the command "quota-update".
Such as "firewall", 'firewall_policy', 'firewall_rule', 'rbac_policy',
'subnetpool'.

Change-Id: Ia3558217ac1f187ead5a510e541fc07f56c4af44
Closes-Bug: #1599061
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/49/338049/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '--firewall', metavar='firewalls', help=_('The limit of firewalls.')) parser.add_argument( '--firewall_policy', metavar='firewall_policies', help=_('The limit of firewall policies.')) parser.add_argument( '--firewall_rule', metavar='firewall_rules', help=_('The limit of firewall rules')) parser.add_argument( '--rbac_policy', metavar='rbac_policies', help=_('The limit of rbac policies.')) parser.add_argument( '--subnetpool', metavar='subnetpools', help=_('The limit of subnetpools.')) parser.add_argument( 'vip', 'pool', 'member', 'health_monitor', 'firewall', 'firewall_policy', 'firewall_rule', 'rbac_policy', 'subnetpool' ):

LBaaSv2 driver

Fix ODL REST api calls for creating and deleting LB pool, listeners, members.

Change-Id: I92acda151a1a23f63db9c469d3473d917bf84be4
Closes-Bug: #1559939

added_lines: super(OpenDaylightLbaasDriverV2, self).__init__(plugin) self.load_balancer = ODLLoadBalancerManager(self) self.listener = ODLListenerManager(self) self.pool = ODLPoolManager(self) self.member = ODLMemberManager(self) self.health_monitor = ODLHealthMonitorManager(self) def __init__(self, driver): self.client = driver.client self.url_path = LBAAS + '/' + self.obj_type super(OpenDaylightManager, self).__init__(driver) @driver_base.driver_op def __init__(self, driver): super(ODLLoadBalancerManager, self).__init__(driver) @log_helpers.log_method_call @driver_base.driver_op def create(self, context, obj): create_obj = { "loadbalancer": { "id": obj.id, "tenant_id": obj.tenant_id, "name": obj.name, "description": obj.description, "vip_address": obj.vip_address, "vip_subnet_id": obj.vip_subnet_id, "status": obj.provisioning_status, "admin_state_up": obj.admin_state_up } } self.client.sendjson('post', self.url_path, create_obj) @log_helpers.log_method_call @driver_base.driver_op def update(self, context, obj): body = { "loadbalancer": { "admin_state_up": obj.admin_state_up, "name": obj.name, "description": obj.description } } self.client.sendjson('put', self.url_path + '/' + obj.id, body) # not implemented by ODL def __init__(self, driver): super(ODLListenerManager, self).__init__(driver) @log_helpers.log_method_call @driver_base.driver_op def delete(self, context, obj): # listeners seem to be broken in lithium # self.client.sendjson('delete', self.url_path + '/' + obj.id, None) pass def __init__(self, driver): commit_message:
Fix unimport '_()' bug

In exception module of octavia, the '_()' wasn't imported, so
wen can't use it. Besides, '_LE()' will be better.

Change-Id: I1a2e524178e538b7925ea78a8d28631a8b71dc0f

Change-Id: I3cca9cd9218ae125ba975a62437cf749f4f0ce57
'}]
commit_message:
Using oracle Java and Skip some bad modules

When build master onos, some bad modules are blocking
whole build. This patch allows to define what app
modules to skip.

As well, use Oracle JDK since the ONOS are recommending it.

Change-Id: I3cca9cd9218ae125ba975a62437cf749f4f0ce57
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-onos refs/changes/44/317944/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ONOS_RELEASE=${ONOS_RELEASE:-master} # Not to build apps if they are blocking build ONOS_SKIP_APPS=${ONOS_SKIP_APPS:-"vpls"}

added_lines: class ListenersTestAdmin(base.BaseAdminTestCase): Neutron-LBaaS API using the REST client for Listeners super(ListenersTestAdmin, cls).resource_setup() cls.tenant_id = 'deffb4d7c0584e89a8ec99551565713c' super(ListenersTestAdmin, cls).resource_cleanup() cls._try_delete_resource(cls._delete_listener, cls.listener_id) cls._wait_for_load_balancer_status( load_balancer_id=cls.load_balancer_id, delete=True) cls._try_delete_resource(cls._delete_load_balancer, cls.load_balancer['id']) cls._wait_for_load_balancer_status( load_balancer_id=cls.load_balancer['id'], delete=True) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_listener_for_tenant(self): """Test create listener for tenant""" create_new_listener_kwargs = self.create_listener_kwargs create_new_listener_kwargs['protocol_port'] = 8080 create_new_listener_kwargs['tenant_id'] = self.tenant_id new_listener = self._create_listener( **create_new_listener_kwargs) new_listener_id = new_listener['id'] self.addCleanup(self._delete_listener, new_listener_id) self._check_status_tree( load_balancer_id=self.load_balancer_id, listener_ids=[self.listener_id, new_listener_id]) listener = self.listeners_client.get_listener( new_listener_id) self.assertEqual(new_listener, listener) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_two_listener_simultaneous(self): """Test create 2 listeners simultaneously""" create_new_listener_kwargs = self.create_listener_kwargs create_new_listener_kwargs['protocol_port'] = 9080 create_new_listener_kwargs['wait'] = False new_listener_1 = self._create_listener(**create_new_listener_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._delete_listener, new_listener_1['id']) create_new_listener_kwargs['protocol_port'] = 9081 new_listener_2 = self._create_listener(**create_new_listener_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._delete_listener, new_listener_2['id']) self._check_status_tree( load_balancer_id=self.load_balancer_id, listener_ids=[self.listener_id, new_listener_1['id']]) self._check_status_tree( load_balancer_id=self.load_balancer_id, listener_ids=[self.listener_id, new_listener_2['id']]) @test.attr(type='negative') def test_create_listener_duplicate_port(self): """Test create listener with a duplicate port fails""" create_new_listener_kwargs = self.create_listener_kwargs create_new_listener_kwargs['protocol_port'] = self.port self.assertRaises(ex.Conflict, self._create_listener, **create_new_listener_kwargs) self._check_status_tree( load_balancer_id=self.load_balancer_id, listener_ids=[self.listener_id]) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_listener_duplicate_protocol(self): """Test create listener with a duplicate protocol""" create_new_listener_kwargs = self.create_listener_kwargs create_new_listener_kwargs['protocol_port'] = 8082 create_new_listener_kwargs['protocol'] = self.protocol new_listener = self._create_listener( **create_new_listener_kwargs) new_listener_id = new_listener['id'] self.addCleanup(self._delete_listener, new_listener_id) self._check_status_tree( load_balancer_id=self.load_balancer_id, listener_ids=[self.listener_id, new_listener_id]) listener = self.listeners_client.get_listener( new_listener_id) self.assertEqual(new_listener, listener) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_update_listener_connection_limit(self): """Test update admin listener connection limit""" new_connection_limit = 9999999999 self._update_listener(self.listener_id, connection_limit=new_connection_limit) self._check_status_tree(load_balancer_id=self.load_balancer_id, listener_ids=[self.listener_id]) listener = self.listeners_client.get_listener( self.listener_id) self.assertEqual(new_connection_limit, listener.get('connection_limit')) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_delete_listener_for_tenant(self): """Test delete listener for tenant as admin""" create_new_listener_kwargs = self.create_listener_kwargs create_new_listener_kwargs['protocol_port'] = 8083 create_new_listener_kwargs['tenant_id'] = self.tenant_id new_listener = self._create_listener(**create_new_listener_kwargs) new_listener_id = new_listener['id'] self._check_status_tree( load_balancer_id=self.load_balancer_id, listener_ids=[self.listener_id, new_listener_id]) listener = self.listeners_client.get_listener(new_listener_id) self.assertEqual(new_listener, listener) self.assertNotEqual(self.listener, new_listener) self._delete_listener(new_listener_id) self.assertRaises(ex.NotFound, self.listeners_client.get_listener, new_listener_id) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_delete_listener(self): """Test delete admin listener""" create_new_listener_kwargs = self.create_listener_kwargs create_new_listener_kwargs['protocol_port'] = 8084 new_listener = self._create_listener(**create_new_listener_kwargs) new_listener_id = new_listener['id'] self._check_status_tree( load_balancer_id=self.load_balancer_id, listener_ids=[self.listener_id, new_listener_id]) listener = self.listeners_client.get_listener(new_listener_id) self.assertEqual(new_listener, listener) self.assertNotEqual(self.listener, new_listener) self._delete_listener(new_listener_id) self.assertRaises(ex.NotFound, self.listeners_client.get_listener, new_listener_id)

commit_message:
Octavia: Health Monitor Scenario Test

* scenario test for health monitoring
* some changes made to base class

Change-Id: I7218d3850f0800ce036bea60232de7fdd3fc2722
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/30/282130/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # Copyright 2016 Rackspace US Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from octavia.tests.tempest.lib import test from octavia.tests.tempest.v1.scenario import base class TestHealthMonitorBasic(base.BaseTestCase): @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_health_monitor_basic(self): """This test checks load balancing with health monitor. The following is the scenario outline: 1. Create two instances. 2. SSH to the instances and start two servers: primary and secondary. 3. Create a load balancer, with two members and with ROUND_ROBIN algorithm, associate the VIP with a floating ip. 4. Create a health monitor. 5. Send NUM requests to the floating ip and check that they are shared between the two servers. 6. Disable the primary server and validate the traffic is being sent only to the secondary server. """ self._create_servers() self._start_servers() self._create_load_balancer() self._create_health_monitor() self._check_load_balancing() # stopping the primary server self._stop_server() # Asserting the traffic is sent only to the secondary server self._traffic_validation_after_stopping_server()

commit_message:
Neutron-LBaaS: Member Scenario Test

* checks that a member is unreachable when:
 * admin_state_up is False
 * weight is 0
 * member is removed from the pool

Change-Id: Ibf3581bf2a22fde29c126c0c6919ffdcc5c93a67
Closes-Bug: #1577529
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/69/310069/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Rackspace Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import test from neutron_lbaas.tests.tempest.v2.scenario import base class TestMember(base.BaseTestCase): @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_member(self): """This test checks load balancing for disabled and removed members. The following is the scenario outline: 1. Create an instance. 2. SSH to the instance and start two servers. 3. Create a load balancer with two members and with ROUND_ROBIN algorithm. 4. Associate the VIP with a floating ip. 5. Send NUM requests to the floating ip and check that they are shared between the two servers. 6. Disable one member and check that it is no longer balanced. 7. Reenable member and check that is is now balanced 8. Update member weight to 0 and check that is is no longer balanced. 9. Remove member and check that it is no longer balanced. """ self._create_server('server1') self._start_servers() self._create_load_balancer() self._check_load_balancing() # Disable one member and check that it's no longer balanced member = self.members_client.list_members(self.pool_id)[0] update_member_kwargs = {'admin_state_up': False} member = self.members_client.update_member( self.pool_id, member['id'], **update_member_kwargs) self._wait_for_load_balancer_status(self.load_balancer['id']) self.assertTrue(member) self.assertEqual(member['admin_state_up'], False) # self._check_connection(self.vip_ip) # counters = self._send_requests(self.vip_ip, ["server1", "server2"]) # import six # for member, counter in six.iteritems(counters): # self.assertGreater(counter, 0, 'Member %s never balanced' % member) self._traffic_validation_after_stopping_server() # Reenable member and check it's balanced update_member_kwargs = {'admin_state_up': True} member = self.members_client.update_member( self.pool_id, member['id'], **update_member_kwargs) self._wait_for_load_balancer_status(self.load_balancer['id']) self.assertTrue(member) self.assertEqual(member['admin_state_up'], True) self._check_load_balancing() # Update member weight to 0 and check that is is no longer balanced. update_member_kwargs = {'weight': 0} member = self.members_client.update_member( self.pool_id, member['id'], **update_member_kwargs) self._wait_for_load_balancer_status(self.load_balancer['id']) self.assertTrue(member) self.assertEqual(member['weight'], 0) self._traffic_validation_after_stopping_server() # Update member weight to 1 and check it's balanced update_member_kwargs = {'weight': 1} member = self.members_client.update_member( self.pool_id, member['id'], **update_member_kwargs) self._wait_for_load_balancer_status(self.load_balancer['id']) self.assertTrue(member) self.assertEqual(member['weight'], 1) self._check_load_balancing() # Remove member and check that it's no longer balanced #update_member_kwargs = {'weight': 0} member = self.members_client.delete_member(self.pool_id, member['id']) self._wait_for_load_balancer_status(self.load_balancer['id']) members = self.members_client.list_members(self.pool_id) self.assertNotIn(member['id'], members) self._traffic_validation_after_stopping_server()

commit_message:
Neutron-LBaaS: Admin Member Update Delete Tests

* update and delete tests for admin
* some create tests added as well

Change-Id: I09d3fa09651cf48a9ce10d94ac501356ed6762ce
Closes-Bug: #1577533
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/91/308091/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from copy import deepcopy from oslo_utils import uuidutilsfrom tempest.lib import decoratorsclass MembersTestAdmin(base.BaseAdminTestCase): Neutron-LBaaS API using the REST client for members super(MembersTestAdmin, cls).resource_setup() # see 1572342: listeners are needed when adding members to a pool cls.new_tenant_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() cls.address = '10.0.0.8' cls.protocol_port = 80 # set by default on api; used for validations cls.weight = 1 cls.admin_state_up = True cls.create_member_kwargs = {'address': cls.address, 'protocol_port': cls.protocol_port, 'subnet_id': cls.subnet_id, 'tenant_id': cls.tenant_id} cls._try_delete_resource(cls._delete_listener, cls.listener.get('id')) cls._wait_for_load_balancer_status( load_balancer_id=cls.load_balancer.get('id')) cls._try_delete_resource(cls._delete_pool, cls.pool.get('id')) cls._wait_for_load_balancer_status( load_balancer_id=cls.load_balancer.get('id')) cls._try_delete_resource(cls._delete_load_balancer, cls.load_balancer.get('id')) cls._wait_for_load_balancer_status( load_balancer_id=cls.load_balancer.get('id'), delete=True) super(MembersTestAdmin, cls).resource_cleanup() def _check_member_attributes(self, member): """Check Member attributes Used in tests that require checking an objects attributes """ self.assertEqual(self.subnet_id, member.get('subnet_id')) self.assertEqual(self.address, member.get('address')) self.assertEqual(self.protocol_port, member.get('protocol_port')) self.assertEqual(self.weight, member.get('weight')) self.assertEqual(self.admin_state_up, member.get('admin_state_up')) def test_create_member_for_admin(self): """Test with admin user create member for admin. """ member = self._create_member(self.pool_id, **self.create_member_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._delete_member, self.pool_id, member.get('id')) self._check_member_attributes(member) self.assertEqual(self.tenant_id, member.get('tenant_id')) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_member_for_another_tenant_id_field(self): """Test with admin user create member for another tenant id. """ create_member_kwargs = deepcopy(self.create_member_kwargs) create_member_kwargs['tenant_id'] = self.new_tenant_id member = self._create_member(self.pool_id, **create_member_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._delete_member, self.pool_id, member.get('id')) self._check_member_attributes(member) self.assertNotEqual(self.tenant_id, member.get('tenant_id')) self.assertEqual(self.new_tenant_id, member.get('tenant_id')) @decorators.skip_because(bug="1571907") @test.attr(type='negative') def test_create_member_invalid_tenant_id(self): """Test create member with invalid tenant_id should fail""" create_member_kwargs = deepcopy(self.create_member_kwargs) create_member_kwargs['tenant_id'] = "$232!$pw" self.assertRaises(ex.BadRequest, self._create_member, self.pool_id, **create_member_kwargs) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_two_identical_members_fails(self): """Test with admin user create two identical members fails. """ create_member_kwargs = deepcopy(self.create_member_kwargs) create_member_kwargs['tenant_id'] = self.new_tenant_id member = self._create_member(self.pool_id, **create_member_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._delete_member, self.pool_id, member.get('id')) self._check_member_attributes(member) self.assertEqual(self.new_tenant_id, member.get('tenant_id')) self.assertRaises(ex.Conflict, self._create_member, self.pool_id, **create_member_kwargs) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_two_members_same_address_diff_port_fails(self): """Test with admin user create two members with same address but different ports succeeds. """ create_member_kwargs = deepcopy(self.create_member_kwargs) create_member_kwargs['tenant_id'] = self.new_tenant_id member = self._create_member(self.pool_id, **create_member_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._delete_member, self.pool_id, member.get('id')) self._check_member_attributes(member) self.assertEqual(self.new_tenant_id, member.get('tenant_id')) new_port = 8080 create_member_kwargs['protocol_port'] = new_port member = self._create_member(self.pool_id, **create_member_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._delete_member, self.pool_id, member.get('id')) self.assertEqual(new_port, member.get('protocol_port')) self.assertEqual(self.address, member['address']) self.assertEqual(self.subnet_id, member.get('subnet_id')) self.assertEqual(self.weight, member.get('weight')) self.assertEqual(self.admin_state_up, member.get('admin_state_up')) self.assertEqual(self.new_tenant_id, member.get('tenant_id')) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_two_members_diff_address_same_port(self): """Test with admin user create two members with different addresses but same port succeeds. """ create_member_kwargs = deepcopy(self.create_member_kwargs) create_member_kwargs['tenant_id'] = self.new_tenant_id member = self._create_member(self.pool_id, **create_member_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._delete_member, self.pool_id, member.get('id')) self._check_member_attributes(member) self.assertEqual(self.new_tenant_id, member.get('tenant_id')) new_address = '10.0.0.9' create_member_kwargs['address'] = new_address member = self._create_member(self.pool_id, **create_member_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._delete_member, self.pool_id, member.get('id')) self.assertEqual(new_address, member['address']) self.assertEqual(self.subnet_id, member.get('subnet_id')) self.assertEqual(self.protocol_port, member.get('protocol_port')) self.assertEqual(self.weight, member.get('weight')) self.assertEqual(self.admin_state_up, member.get('admin_state_up')) self.assertEqual(self.new_tenant_id, member.get('tenant_id')) create_member_kwargs = deepcopy(self.create_member_kwargs) create_member_kwargs['tenant_id'] = "" self.pool_id, **create_member_kwargs) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_update_member_for_tenant(self): """Test that we can update a member of another tenant""" create_member_kwargs = deepcopy(self.create_member_kwargs) create_member_kwargs['tenant_id'] = self.new_tenant_id member = self._create_member(self.pool_id, **create_member_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._delete_member, self.pool_id, member.get('id')) self._check_member_attributes(member) update_member_kwargs = {"weight": 10, "admin_state_up": False} member = self._update_member(self.pool_id, member.get('id'), **update_member_kwargs) self.assertFalse(member["admin_state_up"]) self.assertEqual(10, member["weight"]) self.assertEqual(self.subnet_id, member.get('subnet_id')) self.assertEqual(self.address, member.get('address')) self.assertEqual(self.protocol_port, member.get('protocol_port')) self.assertEqual(self.new_tenant_id, member.get('tenant_id')) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_delete_member_for_tenant(self): """Test that we can delete a member for another tenant""" create_member_kwargs = deepcopy(self.create_member_kwargs) create_member_kwargs['tenant_id'] = self.new_tenant_id member = self._create_member(self.pool_id, **create_member_kwargs) self._check_member_attributes(member) members = self.members_client.list_members(self.pool_id) self.assertEqual(1, len(members)) self._delete_member(self.pool_id, member.get('id')) members = self.members_client.list_members(self.pool_id) self.assertEmpty(members) self.assertRaises(ex.NotFound, self.members_client.get_member, self.pool_id, member.get('id'))

commit_message:
Use osprofiler.initializer to set up osprofiler notifier

osprofiler.initializer has been introduced to osprofiler.
It does the same things as setup() in profiler.py does.
So we'd better use the API provided by osprofiler to set
up the osprofiler notifier.

Change-Id: I3a4f2fffed00c76e972160f7fc74910386cff431
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/81/353281/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from osprofiler import initializer initializer.init_from_conf(CONF, {}, "neutron", name, host)
deleted_lines: import osprofiler.notifierimport osprofiler.web _notifier = osprofiler.notifier.create( "Messaging", oslo_messaging, {}, oslo_messaging.get_transport(CONF), "neutron", name, host) osprofiler.notifier.set(_notifier) osprofiler.web.enable(CONF.profiler.hmac_keys)

subject: Fixed Load balancer VIP reachability issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 07:26:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/d616b7874e3e193fdfa52750345710fb387d7409', 'message': 'Fixed Load balancer VIP reachability issue

During network plug for the amphora-haproxy namespace, plug.py checks for eth1.cfg
under /etc/netns/amphora-haproxy/network/interfaces.d/ but in HPE linux ubuntu
does not have eth1.cfg instead it will be having eth1 so the
plug.py unable to plug the vip for the eth1 interface as there is no .cfg
file extension. As a result of this VIP is not reachable for this VM.

This fix is generic as it will work for any ethernet extension file for the VIP

Change-Id: Id74faafdaa38496b341002f8213cb1d5f2c8bab2

commit_message:
Fixed Load balancer VIP reachability issue

During network plug for the amphora-haproxy namespace, plug.py checks
for eth1.cfg under /etc/netns/amphora-haproxy/network/interfaces.d/
but in HPE linux ubuntu does not have eth1.cfg instead it will be
having eth1 so the plug.py unable to plug the vip for the eth1
interface as there is no .cfg file extension. As a result of this
VIP is not reachable for this VM.

This fix is generic as it will work for any ethernet extension
file for the VIP

Change-Id: Id74faafdaa38496b341002f8213cb1d5f2c8bab2
Co-Authored-By: Maurya Alok Kumar <alok-kumar.maurya@hpe.com>

commit_message:
Create plugin driver for F5 Networks appliances.

Implements an LBaaS v2 plugin driver for F5 Networks appliances.
The plugin implementation is a shim only, and the complete
driver implementation exists outside of the neutron-lbaas tree.
A unit test is also included in this commit.

Change-Id: I7018943c0ed2cf68e23e4ff4a82d5b9f2bd3290a
Closes-Bug: 1539717

commit_message:
WIP: Close octavia handler and n-lbaas driver gaps

First part to add in the functionality that neutron-lbaas drivers expect.
A shim layer is added that mimics calls to the neutron core_plugin but instead
actually makes a REST call.  This should be transparent to the drivers though
and based on the code that was in tree, all calls to the core_plugin should be
implemented.  However, for drivers that are just pass-through drivers, some
core_plugin may still need to be implemented.

What is still needed is a shim layer to the db that the plugins had access to.
Also, helper methods that automatically set the statuses of the resources.

Change-Id: I5d9cf03ef2a169d479282fcc0891f663bb277d4f

deleted_lines: def _validate_create_pool(self, session, pool_dict): session, pool_dict, listener_id=self.listener_id) for listener_id in self._get_affected_listener_ids(session): session, listener_id, provisioning_status=constants.ACTIVE) session, self.load_balancer_id, self.handler.create(db_pool) except Exception: for listener_id in self._get_affected_listener_ids(session): session, listener_id, operating_status=constants.ERROR) db_pool = self._get_db_pool(session, db_pool.id) return self._validate_create_pool(context.session, pool_dict) self.handler.update(db_pool, pool) self.handler.delete(db_pool)

added_lines: class GenerateDistributorServerPEMTask(BaseCertTask): """Create the server certs for the agent comm Use the amphora_id for the CN """ def execute(self, distributor_id): cert = self.cert_generator.generate_cert_key_pair( cn=distributor_id, validity=CERT_VALIDITY) return cert.certificate + cert.private_key

commit_message:
WIP: ACTIVE-ACTIVE - distributor creation flow

Added distributor create flow and tasks

Change-Id: I2ee81a8b207715d759547b3ee9c64c6cd65f17b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/08/341108/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # from oslo_config import cfg from taskflow.patterns import linear_flow from taskflow import retry from octavia.common import constants from octavia.controller.worker.tasks import cert_task from octavia.controller.worker.tasks import compute_tasks from octavia.controller.worker.tasks import database_tasks from octavia.controller.worker.tasks import distributor_driver_tasks CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.import_group('controller_worker', 'octavia.common.config') class DistributorFlows(object): def __init__(self): # for some reason only this has the values from the config file self.REST_DISTRIBUTOR_DRIVER = ( CONF.active_active_cluster.distributor_driver == 'distributor_rest_driver') def get_create_distributor_flow(self): """Creates a flow to create a distributor. Ideally that should be configurable in the config file - a db session needs to be placed into the flow :returns: The flow for creating the amphora """ create_distributor_flow = linear_flow.Flow( constants.CREATE_DISTRIBUTOR_FLOW) create_distributor_flow.add(database_tasks.CreateDistributorInDB( provides=constants.DISTRIBUTOR_ID)) create_distributor_flow.add(cert_task.GenerateDistributorServerPEMTask( provides=constants.SERVER_PEM)) create_distributor_flow.add(compute_tasks.CertDistributorComputeCreate( requires=(constants.DISTRIBUTOR_ID, constants.SERVER_PEM), provides=constants.COMPUTE_ID)) create_distributor_flow.add(database_tasks.MarkDistributorBootingInDB( requires=(constants.DISTRIBUTOR_ID, constants.COMPUTE_ID))) wait_flow = linear_flow.Flow(constants.WAIT_FOR_DISTRIBUTOR, retry=retry.Times(CONF. controller_worker. amp_active_retries)) wait_flow.add(compute_tasks.DistributorComputeWait( requires=constants.COMPUTE_ID, provides=constants.COMPUTE_OBJ)) wait_flow.add(database_tasks.UpdateDistributorInfo( requires=(constants.DISTRIBUTOR_ID, constants.COMPUTE_OBJ), provides=constants.DISTRIBUTOR)) create_distributor_flow.add(wait_flow) create_distributor_flow.add(database_tasks.ReloadDistributor( requires=constants.DISTRIBUTOR_ID, provides=constants.DISTRIBUTOR)) create_distributor_flow.add( distributor_driver_tasks.DistributorFinalize( requires=constants.DISTRIBUTOR)) create_distributor_flow.add(database_tasks.MarkDistributorReadyInDB( requires=constants.DISTRIBUTOR)) return create_distributor_flow

added_lines: conf.config(group="active_active_cluster", distributor_flavor_id=AMP_FLAVOR_ID) conf.config(group="active_active_cluster", distributor_image_id=AMP_IMAGE_ID) comp_flavor=AMP_FLAVOR_ID, @mock.patch('octavia.distributor.backend.agent.' 'distributor_jinja_cfg.DistributorJinjaTemplater.' 'build_agent_config', return_value='test_conf') @mock.patch('stevedore.driver.DriverManager.driver') def test_distributor_compute_create(self, mock_driver, mock_conf, mock_jinja): conf = oslo_fixture.Config(cfg.CONF) conf.config(group="controller_worker", amp_network=AMP_NET) createcompute = compute_tasks.DistributorComputeCreate() mock_driver.build.return_value = COMPUTE_ID # Test execute() compute_id = createcompute.execute(_amphora_mock.id, ports=[_port]) # Validate that the build method was called properly mock_driver.build.assert_called_once_with( name="distributor-" + _amphora_mock.id, comp_flavor=AMP_FLAVOR_ID, image_id=AMP_IMAGE_ID, key_name=AMP_SSH_KEY_NAME, sec_groups=AMP_SEC_GROUPS, network_ids=AMP_NET, port_ids=[PORT_ID], config_drive_files={'/etc/octavia/' 'distributor-agent.conf': 'test_conf'}) # Make sure it returns the expected compute_id assert(compute_id == COMPUTE_ID) # Test that a build exception is raised createcompute = compute_tasks.DistributorComputeCreate() self.assertRaises(TypeError, createcompute.execute, _amphora_mock, config_drive_files='test_cert') # Test revert() _amphora_mock.compute_id = COMPUTE_ID createcompute = compute_tasks.ComputeCreate() createcompute.revert(compute_id, _amphora_mock.id) # Validate that the delete method was called properly mock_driver.delete.assert_called_once_with( COMPUTE_ID) # Test that a delete exception is not raised createcompute.revert(COMPUTE_ID, _amphora_mock.id) @mock.patch('jinja2.Environment.get_template') comp_flavor=AMP_FLAVOR_ID, comp_flavor=AMP_FLAVOR_ID, comp_flavor=AMP_FLAVOR_ID, @mock.patch('jinja2.Environment.get_template') @mock.patch('octavia.distributor.backend.agent.' 'distributor_jinja_cfg.DistributorJinjaTemplater.' 'build_agent_config', return_value='test_conf') @mock.patch('stevedore.driver.DriverManager.driver') def test_distributor_compute_create_cert(self, mock_driver, mock_conf, mock_jinja): createcompute = compute_tasks.CertDistributorComputeCreate() mock_driver.build.return_value = COMPUTE_ID path = '/etc/octavia/certs/ca_01.pem' self.useFixture(test_utils.OpenFixture(path, 'test')) # Test execute() compute_id = createcompute.execute(_amphora_mock.id, 'test_cert' ) # Validate that the build method was called properly mock_driver.build.assert_called_once_with( name="distributor-" + _amphora_mock.id, comp_flavor=AMP_FLAVOR_ID, image_id=AMP_IMAGE_ID, key_name=AMP_SSH_KEY_NAME, sec_groups=AMP_SEC_GROUPS, network_ids=AMP_NET, port_ids=[], config_drive_files={ '/etc/octavia/certs/server.pem': 'test_cert', '/etc/octavia/certs/client_ca.pem': 'test', '/etc/octavia/distributor-agent.conf': 'test_conf'}) # Make sure it returns the expected compute_id assert (compute_id == COMPUTE_ID) # Test that a build exception is raised self.useFixture(test_utils.OpenFixture(path, 'test')) createcompute = compute_tasks.ComputeCreate() self.assertRaises(TypeError, createcompute.execute, _amphora_mock, config_drive_files='test_cert') # Test revert() _amphora_mock.compute_id = COMPUTE_ID createcompute = compute_tasks.ComputeCreate() createcompute.revert(compute_id, _amphora_mock.id) # Validate that the delete method was called properly mock_driver.delete.assert_called_once_with(COMPUTE_ID) # Test that a delete exception is not raised createcompute.revert(COMPUTE_ID, _amphora_mock.id) def test_distributor_compute_wait(self, mock_time_sleep, mock_driver): _amphora_mock.compute_id = COMPUTE_ID _amphora_mock.status = constants.ACTIVE _amphora_mock.lb_network_ip = LB_NET_IP mock_driver.get_distributor.return_value = _amphora_mock computewait = compute_tasks.DistributorComputeWait() computewait.execute(COMPUTE_ID) mock_driver.get_distributor.assert_called_once_with(COMPUTE_ID) _amphora_mock.status = constants.DELETED self.assertRaises(exceptions.ComputeWaitTimeoutException, computewait.execute, _amphora_mock) @mock.patch('stevedore.driver.DriverManager.driver') @mock.patch('time.sleep')

commit_message:
WIP: ACTIVE-ACTIVE - create distributor network flow

Adds distributor network subflow for ACTIVE-ACTIVE topology.
In this flow VIP for new load balancer is allocated and the
distributor is plugged with the VIP

Change-Id: I8ac130ed1aaf98c45ed9c2dc04112d0010cfb79c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/04/359304/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_utils import uuidutils from taskflow.types import failure from octavia.common import constants from octavia.common import data_models from octavia.controller.worker.tasks import distributor_driver_tasks from octavia.db import repositories as repo import octavia.tests.unit.base as base DISTRIBUTOR_ID = uuidutils.generate_uuid() COMPUTE_ID = uuidutils.generate_uuid() LISTENER_ID = uuidutils.generate_uuid() LB_ID = uuidutils.generate_uuid() _distributor_mock = mock.MagicMock() _distributor_mock.id = DISTRIBUTOR_ID _distributor_mock.status = constants.DISTRIBUTOR_READY _load_balancer_mock = mock.MagicMock() _load_balancer_mock.id = LB_ID _LB_mock = mock.MagicMock() _session_mock = mock.MagicMock() @mock.patch('octavia.db.api.get_session', return_value=_session_mock) @mock.patch('octavia.controller.worker.tasks.amphora_driver_tasks.LOG') @mock.patch('oslo_utils.uuidutils.generate_uuid', return_value=DISTRIBUTOR_ID) @mock.patch('stevedore.driver.DriverManager.driver') class TestDistributorDriverTasks(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestDistributorDriverTasks, self).setUp() _LB_mock.id = LB_ID @mock.patch('octavia.db.repositories.LoadBalancerRepository.update') @mock.patch('octavia.db.repositories.LoadBalancerRepository.get', return_value=_LB_mock) def test_distributor_post_vip_plug(self, mock_loadbalancer_repo_update, mock_loadbalancer_repo_get, mock_driver, mock_generate_uuid, mock_log, mock_get_session): distributor_post_vip_plug_obj = \ distributor_driver_tasks.DistributorPostVIPPlug() distributor_post_vip_plug_obj.execute(_distributor_mock, _LB_mock, " ") mock_driver.post_vip_plug.assert_called_once_with( _distributor_mock, _LB_mock, " ") # Test revert distr = distributor_post_vip_plug_obj.revert(None, _LB_mock) repo.LoadBalancerRepository.update.assert_called_once_with( _session_mock, id=LB_ID, status=constants.ERROR) self.assertIsNone(distr)

added_lines: self.amphora_cluster_repo = repo.AmphoraClusterRepository() lb_network_ip=distributor.lb_network_ip) class CreateAmphoraClusterInDB(BaseDatabaseTask): """Task to create an initial cluster in the Database.""" def execute(self, distributor_id, loadbalancer_id, cluster_dict=None): """Creates an amphora_cluster record in the database. :param loadbalancer_id: id of load_balancer for the cluster :param cluster_dict: Dictionary representation of a cluster :return: string to represent octavia.common.data_models.AmphoraCluster """ if not cluster_dict: cluster_dict = {} LOG.debug("Creating amphora cluster for loadbalancer id: %s ", loadbalancer_id) amphora_cluster = self.repos.create_amphora_cluster_on_load_balancer( db_apis.get_session(), loadbalancer_id, cluster_dict) self.amphora_cluster_repo.associate(db_apis.get_session(), distributor_id, loadbalancer_id) return "cluster-" + str(loadbalancer_id) def revert(self, result, *args, **kwargs): if isinstance(result, failure.Failure): # This task's execute failed, so nothing needed to be done to # revert return # At this point the revert is being called because another task # executed after this failed so we will need to do something and # result is the cluster's id LOG.warn( _LW("Reverting create cluster in DB for cluster id %s "), result) # Delete the cluster for now. May want to just update LB status later self.amphora_repo.delete(db_apis.get_session(), id=result) class UpdateAmphoraClusterInDB(BaseDatabaseTask): """Update the Amphora Cluster in the DB. Since sqlalchemy will likely retry by itself always revert if it fails """ def execute(self, loadbalancer_id, update_dict): """Update the amphora cluster in the DB :param loadbalancer_id: The load_balancer_id of cluster to be updated :param update_dict: The dictionary of updates to apply :returns: None """ LOG.debug("Update AmphoraCluster DB for " "loadbalancer_id: %s ", loadbalancer_id) self.cluster_repo.update(db_apis.get_session(), loadbalancer_id, **update_dict) def revert(self, amphora_cluster, *args, **kwargs): """Mark the cluster ERROR since the update couldn't happen :returns: None """ LOG.warn(_LW("Reverting update amphora_cluster in DB " "for amphora_cluster_id %s"), amphora_cluster.id) self.cluster_repo.update(db_apis.get_session(), amphora_cluster.id, enabled=0) class GetAmphoraClusterFromLoadbalancer(BaseDatabaseTask): """Task to pull the cluster from a loadbalancer.""" def execute(self, loadbalancer): """ :type loadbalancer: data_models.LoadBalancer :rtype: data_models.AmphoraCluster """ return loadbalancer.amphora_cluster def revert(self, *args, **kwargs): pass class DeleteAmphoraClusterInDB(BaseDatabaseTask): """Delete the amphora_cluster in the DB. Since sqlalchemy will likely retry by itself always revert if it fails """ def execute(self, loadbalancer): """Delete the amphora_cluster in DB :param loadbalancer: The load_balanacer of the cluster to delete :type loadbalancer: data_models.LoadBalancer :returns: None """ LOG.debug("DB delete amphora_cluster for load_balancer id: %s ", loadbalancer.id) self.cluster_repo.delete(db_apis.get_session(), load_balancer_id=loadbalancer.id) def revert(self, loadbalancer, *args, **kwargs): """Mark the amphora_cluster not enabled since the mark active couldn't happen :returns: None """ LOG.debug("Reverting amphora cluster delete in DB " "for cluster on loadbalancer with id %s", loadbalancer.id) update_dict = {'enabled': False} self.cluster_repo.update(db_apis.get_session(), loadbalancer_id=loadbalancer.id, **update_dict)

added_lines: class DistributorGetInfo(BaseDistributorTask): """Task to get information on a distributor.""" def execute(self, distributor): """Execute get_info routine for a distributor.""" self.distributor_driver.get_info(distributor) class DistributorRegisterAmphora(BaseDistributorTask): def execute(self, distributor, loadbalancer, amphora, alg_extra): load_balancer = self.loadbalancer_repo.get(db_apis.get_session(), id=loadbalancer.id) self.distributor_driver.register_amphora(distributor, load_balancer, amphora, alg_extra) def revert(self, result, loadbalancer, *args, **kwargs): if isinstance(result, failure.Failure): return LOG.warn(_LW("Reverting register amphora.")) class DistributorUnregisterAmphora(BaseDistributorTask): def execute(self, distributor, loadbalancer, amphora, alg_extra): load_balancer = self.loadbalancer_repo.get(db_apis.get_session(), id=loadbalancer.id) self.distributor_driver.register_amphora(distributor, load_balancer, amphora, alg_extra) def revert(self, result, loadbalancer, *args, **kwargs): if isinstance(result, failure.Failure): return LOG.warn(_LW("Reverting register amphora."))
