Change-Id: I69ae0c97d998ba90d5d10491dd63f297d32de6c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/10/359310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you mayimport logging import subprocess import shlex import six import netifaces import netaddr import time from octavia.i18n import _, _LE, _LI from octavia.common.constants import ALG_ACTIVE_ACTIVE LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) # configuration constants OF_VERSION = 'OpenFlow15' OVS_CMD_TIMEOUT = '10' # type: str BR_NAME_FORMAT = 'vip-{}' BR_NAME_LENGTH = 14 WAIT_FOR_OVS_RETRIES = 5 # careful, exponential back-off MAX_DISTRIBUTORS = 128 MAX_CLUSTER_SIZE = 512 # internal constants HASH_SRC_PORT = {4: ('ip_src', 'tcp_src'), 6: ('ipv6_src', 'tcp_src')} HASH_SRC_ONLY = {4: 'ip_src', 6: 'ipv6_src'} DST_GROUPS_OFFSET = 100 SELECT_GROUP_ID = 1 PRIORITY_LOW = 0 PRIORITY_MED = 100 PRIORITY_HIGH = 200 STATUS_EDIT = 'Edited' STATUS_READY = 'Ready' STATUS_DEGRADED = 'Degraded' # command string formats VSCTL_ADD_BR = '--may-exist add-br {distributor.bridge}' VSCTL_DEL_BR = '--if-exists del-br {distributor.bridge}' VSCTL_SET_PROTOCOL = ('set bridge {distributor.bridge}' ' protocols={distributor.of_version}') VSCTL_GET_BRPORT = 'get Interface {distributor.bridge} ofport' VSCTL_GET_IFPORT = 'get Interface {distributor.iface} ofport' VSCTL_ADD_PORT = ('--may-exist add-port {distributor.bridge}' ' {distributor.iface}') VSCTL_REQUEST_PORT = ('set interface {distributor.iface}' ' ofport_request={port}') VSCTL_DEL_PORT = ('--if-exists --with-iface del-port' ' {distributor.bridge} {distributor.iface}') VSCTL_SET_EXTERNAL_ID = ('br-set-external-id {distributor.bridge}' ' {key} {value}') OFCTL_IFUP = 'mod-port {distributor.ofport} up' OFCTL_IFDOWN = 'mod-port {distributor.ofport} down' OFCTL_ADD_FLOW_STDIN = '--bundle add-flow {distributor.bridge} -' OFCTL_ADD_GROUP_STDIN = '--bundle add-group {distributor.bridge} -' OFCTL_DEL_FLOWS = 'del-flows {distributor.bridge}' class DistributorlError(Exception): """Error in OVS controller operation.""" pass _distributors = {} # type: Dict[str, Distributor] _ovs_is_initialized = False def post_plug_vip(interface, vip_ip, mac_address, subnet_cidr, gateway, alg_extra): """Create new Distributor ovs bridge instance :param interface: name of external interface :param vip_ip: load-balancer VIP address :param mac_address: mac of external interface :param subnet_cidr: unused :param gateway: unused :param alg_extra: {'size'=cluster size, 'type'=ACTIVE_ACTIVE} :return: distributor instance """ assert alg_extra['type'] == ALG_ACTIVE_ACTIVE size = alg_extra['size'] if size > MAX_CLUSTER_SIZE: raise DistributorlError(_( 'Cannot create Distributor instance on iface %(iface)s.' ' Distributor size %(size)s exceeds maximal size %(max)s' ) % dict(iface=interface, size=size, max=MAX_CLUSTER_SIZE)) if len(_distributors) >= MAX_DISTRIBUTORS: raise DistributorlError(_('Reached maximum Distributors, %s') % MAX_DISTRIBUTORS) vip = netaddr.IPAddress(vip_ip) iface_mac = netaddr.EUI(mac_address, dialect=netaddr.mac_unix) LOG.info( _LI('Creating new Distributor instance for vip=%(vip)s,' ' mac=%(mac)s, iface=%(iface)s, size=%(size)d'), dict(vip=vip, mac=iface_mac, iface=interface, size=size)) init_ovs() br_name = gen_br_name(interface) distributor = Distributor(name=br_name, vip=vip, mac=iface_mac, iface=interface, size=size) try: distributor.create_br() distributor.add_external_port() distributor.add_default_destination_groups() distributor.add_hash_select_group() distributor.del_default_flows() distributor.add_vip_flows() distributor.bring_if_up() except DistributorlError: LOG.exception(_LE('Error while creating Distributor instance on' ' interface %s'), interface) distributor.del_br() raise _distributors[interface] = distributor return distributor """Start forwarding to given Amphora :param vip: load-balancer VIP address -- verify only :param mac: mac of external interface -- verify only :param interface: name of external interface :param subnet_cidr: unused :param gateway: unused :param amphora_mac: mac used for forwarding :param alg_extra: dict(size=desired cluster size,type=ACTIVE_ACTIVE) """ if interface not in _distributors: raise DistributorlError(_( 'Register failed - no Distributor instance for iface %s.' ) % interface) distributor = _distributors[interface] assert alg_extra['type'] == ALG_ACTIVE_ACTIVE assert alg_extra['size'] == distributor.size assert distributor.vip == netaddr.IPAddress(vip) assert distributor.mac == netaddr.EUI(mac, dialect=netaddr.mac_unix) distributor.register_amphora(amphora_mac) def unregister_amphora(vip, mac, interface, subnet_cidr, gateway, amphora_mac, alg_extra): """Stop forwarding to given Amphora :param vip: load-balancer VIP address -- verify only :param mac: mac of external interface -- verify only :param interface: name of external interface :param subnet_cidr: unused :param gateway: unused :param amphora_mac: disable forwarding to this mac :param alg_extra: dict(size=desired cluster size,type=ACTIVE_ACTIVE) """ if interface not in _distributors: raise DistributorlError(_( 'Unregister failed - no Distributor instance for iface %s.' ) % interface) distributor = _distributors[interface] assert distributor.vip == netaddr.IPAddress(vip) assert distributor.mac == netaddr.EUI(mac, dialect=netaddr.mac_unix) assert alg_extra['type'] == ALG_ACTIVE_ACTIVE assert alg_extra['size'] == distributor.size distributor.unregister_amphora(amphora_mac) def pre_uplug_vip(interface, vip, mac): """ Delete Distributor instance on given interface :param interface: name of external interface :param vip: load-balancer VIP address -- verify only :param mac: mac of external interface -- verify only """ if interface not in _distributors: msg = _('Cannot delete no-existent Distributor instance on' ' interface %s)') % interface LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) distributor = _distributors[interface] assert distributor.vip == netaddr.IPAddress(vip) assert distributor.mac == netaddr.EUI(mac, dialect=netaddr.mac_unix) LOG.info(_LI('Deleting Distributor instance %s'), distributor) del _distributors[interface] distributor.del_br() return distributor def get_status(interface): """ Delete Distributor instance on given interface :param interface: name of external interface """ if interface not in _distributors: msg = _('Cannot get status for no-existent Distributor' ' instance on interface %s)') % interface LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) distributor = _distributors[interface] return distributor.get_status() def dump_state(interface): """ Dump Distributor state that can be loaded to similar instance :param interface: name of external interface :return dictionary of slot int to Amphora mac str """ if interface not in _distributors: msg = _('Cannot dump state of no-existent Distributor' ' instance on interface %s') % interface LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) distributor = _distributors[interface] return distributor.dump_state() def load_state(interface, slot_to_mac): """ Load Distributor state that was dumped from another instance :param interface: name of external interface :param slot_to_mac: dictionary of slot int to Amphora mac str """ if interface not in _distributors: msg = _('Cannot load state to no-existent Distributor' ' instance on interface %s') % interface LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) distributor = _distributors[interface] return distributor.load_state(slot_to_mac) class Distributor: _OS_ERROR_CODE = 666 def __init__(self, name, vip, mac, iface, size, of_version=OF_VERSION, timeout=OVS_CMD_TIMEOUT): self.of_version = of_version self.timeout = timeout # type: str self.bridge = name self.vip = vip self.hash_selection_fields = HASH_SRC_PORT[vip.version] self.mac = mac self.iface = iface self.ofport = None self.size = size self.destinations = dict() self.free_slots = set() def __repr__(self): self.free_slots.add('sus') return 'Distributor{args}'.format(args=(self.bridge, self.vip, self.mac, self.iface, self.size, )) def register_amphora(self, amphora_mac): if not self.free_slots: msg = _('Cannot register Amphora %s. No free slots' ) % amphora_mac LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) slot = self.free_slots.pop() mac = netaddr.EUI(amphora_mac, dialect=netaddr.mac_unix) amphora_bucket = gen_bucket_string( 1, 'mod_dl_src={src_mac}'.format(src_mac=self.mac), 'mod_dl_dst={dst_mac}'.format(dst_mac=mac), 'IN_PORT') amphora_group = gen_group_string('modify', slot, amphora_bucket, type='indirect') ret, out, err = self.run_ofctl( cmd=OFCTL_ADD_GROUP_STDIN.format(distributor=self), stdinput=amphora_group ) if ret == 0: self.destinations[mac] = slot return # reclaim free slot self.free_slots.add(slot) msg = _('Error while registering Amphora %(mac)s on bridge' ' %(br)s, exist_status=%(ret)d' '
sterr=%(err)s' ) % dict(mac=mac, br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err) LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) def unregister_amphora(self, amphora_mac): mac = netaddr.EUI(amphora_mac, dialect=netaddr.mac_unix) if mac not in self.destinations: msg = _('Cannot unregister unknown Amphora %s' ) % amphora_mac LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) slot = self.destinations.pop(mac) drop_bucket = gen_bucket_string(1, 'drop') drop_group = gen_group_string('modify', slot, drop_bucket, type='indirect') ret, out, err = self.run_ofctl( cmd=OFCTL_ADD_GROUP_STDIN.format(distributor=self), stdinput=drop_group) if ret == 0: self.free_slots.add(slot) return # reclaim destination slot self.destinations[mac] = slot self.free_slots.add(slot) msg = _('Error while unregistering Amphora %(mac)s on bridge' ' %(br)s, exist_status=%(ret)d' '
sterr=%(err)s' ) % dict(mac=mac, br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err) LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) def del_br(self): ret, out, err = self.run_ofctl( OFCTL_IFDOWN.format(distributor=self)) if ret != 0: LOG.error(_LE( 'Error bringing interface %(iface)s down on' ' bridge %(br)s, exit_status=%(ret)d' '
stderr=%(err)s' ), dict(iface=self.iface, br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err)) ret, out, err = self.run_vsctl( VSCTL_DEL_BR.format(distributor=self)) if ret != 0: LOG.error(_LE( 'Error deleting bridge %(br)s, exit_status=%(ret)d' '
stderr=%(err)s' ), dict(br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err)) def get_status(self): if len(self.destinations) == self.size: return STATUS_READY if len(self.destinations) + len(self.free_slots) < self.size: return STATUS_EDIT return STATUS_DEGRADED def dump_state(self): return {slot: str(mac) for mac, slot in six.iteritems(self.destinations)} def load_state(self, slot_to_mac_dict): if len(slot_to_mac_dict) != self.size: msg = _( 'Cannot load state. State size %(state_size) does not' ' match size Distributor size %(size)' ) % dict(state_size=len(slot_to_mac_dict), size=self.size) LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) if set(slot_to_mac_dict) != self.free_slots: msg = _('State slots do not match free slots') LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) self.free_slots.clear() amphora_groups = [] for slot, amphora_mac in six.iteritems(slot_to_mac_dict): mac = netaddr.EUI(amphora_mac, dialect=netaddr.mac_unix) amphora_bucket = gen_bucket_string( 1, 'mod_dl_src={src_mac}'.format(src_mac=self.mac), 'mod_dl_dst={dst_mac}'.format(dst_mac=mac), 'IN_PORT') amphora_groups.append(gen_group_string( 'modify', slot, amphora_bucket, type='indirect')) self.destinations[mac] = slot ret, out, err = self.run_ofctl( cmd=OFCTL_ADD_GROUP_STDIN.format(distributor=self), stdinput='
'.join(amphora_groups)) if ret == 0: return # reclaim free slot self.free_slots = set(slot_to_mac_dict) msg = _('Error while loading state for bridge %(br)s,' ' exist_status=%(ret)d' '
sterr=%(err)s' ) % dict(br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err) LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) def create_br(self): """ Adds a bridge, sets protocol to 1.5 """ # @TODO also consider disabling forwarding on bridge port and # setting secure fail-over mode ret, out, err = self.run_vsctl( VSCTL_ADD_BR.format(distributor=self), VSCTL_SET_PROTOCOL.format(distributor=self), VSCTL_SET_EXTERNAL_ID.format(distributor=self, key='distributor-vip', value=self.vip)) if ret == 0: # wait for DB update ret, out, err = self.run_vsctl( VSCTL_GET_BRPORT.format(distributor=self)) if ret == 0: return msg = _( 'Error while creating bridge %(br)s, exit_status=%(ret)d' '
stderr=%(err)s' ) % dict(br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err) LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) def add_external_port(self, port_id=1): ret, out, err = self.run_vsctl( VSCTL_ADD_PORT.format(distributor=self), VSCTL_REQUEST_PORT.format(distributor=self, port=port_id)) if ret == 0: ret, out, err = self.run_vsctl( VSCTL_GET_IFPORT.format(distributor=self)) if out.strip() == '[]': # ovs sometimes returns empty port set if not ready yet time.sleep(OVS_CMD_TIMEOUT) ret, out, err = self.run_vsctl( VSCTL_GET_IFPORT.format(distributor=self)) if ret == 0: out = out.strip() try: port = int(out) except ValueError: msg = _( 'add port %(port)d for bridge %(br)s returned' ' non-int result %(got)s' ) % dict(port=port_id, br=self.bridge, got=out) LOG.exception(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) else: if port != port_id: LOG.debug(_LI( 'add port for bridge %(br)s got port' ' %(got)d instead of requested port %(req)d' ), dict(br=self.bridge, got=port, req=port_id)) self.ofport = port return msg = _('Error adding port %(port)d to bridge %(br)s,' ' exist_status=%(ret)d' '
sterr=%(err)s' ) % dict(port=port_id, br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err) LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) def add_default_destination_groups(self): drop_bucket = gen_bucket_string(1, 'drop') destination_slots = range(start=DST_GROUPS_OFFSET, stop=DST_GROUPS_OFFSET + self.size) drop_groups = [gen_group_string('add', slot, drop_bucket, type='indirect') for slot in destination_slots] ret, out, err = self.run_ofctl( cmd=OFCTL_ADD_GROUP_STDIN.format(distributor=self), stdinput='
'.join(drop_groups) ) if ret == 0: self.free_slots.update(destination_slots) return msg = _('Error while creating default groups for bridge %(br)s,' ' exist_status=%(ret)d' '
sterr=%(err)s' ) % dict(br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err) LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) def add_hash_select_group(self): # use deterministic hash seed based on vip seed = hash(self.vip) % 32768 destination_slots = range(start=DST_GROUPS_OFFSET, stop=DST_GROUPS_OFFSET + self.size) buckets = [gen_bucket_string(slot, 'group:{id}'.format(id=slot)) for slot in destination_slots] group = gen_group_string('add', SELECT_GROUP_ID, *buckets, fields=self.hash_selection_fields, selection_method_param=seed) ret, out, err = self.run_ofctl( cmd=OFCTL_ADD_GROUP_STDIN.format(distributor=self), stdinput=group) if ret == 0: return msg = _('Error creating selection group for bridge %(br)s, ' 'exist_status=%(ret)d' '
sterr=%(err)s' ) % dict(br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err) LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) def del_default_flows(self): ret, out, err = self.run_ofctl( cmd=OFCTL_DEL_FLOWS.format(distributor=self)) if ret == 0: return msg = _('Error deleting default flows for bridge %(br)s,' ' exist_status=%(ret)d' '
sterr=%(err)s' ) % dict(br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err) LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) def add_vip_flows(self): # default drop flow drop_flow = gen_flow_string('add', {}, 'drop', table=0, priority=PRIORITY_LOW) vip_flows = [drop_flow] # arp / nd responder if self.vip.version == 4: arp_match = dict(in_port=self.ofport, arp=True, arp_tpa=self.vip) arp_action_list = ( 'set_field:2->arp_op', 'move:NXM_OF_ETH_SRC[]->NXM_OF_ETH_DST[]', 'set_field:{mac}->eth_src'.format(mac=self.mac), 'move:NXM_NX_ARP_SHA[]->NXM_NX_ARP_THA[]', 'set_field:{mac}->arp_sha'.format(mac=self.mac), 'move:NXM_OF_ARP_SPA[]->NXM_OF_ARP_TPA[]', 'set_field:{vip}->arp_spa'.format(vip=self.vip), 'IN_PORT', ) arp_flow = gen_flow_string('add', arp_match, *arp_action_list, table=0, priority=PRIORITY_MED) vip_flows.append(arp_flow) elif self.vip.version == 6: nd_match = dict(in_port=self.ofport, icmpv6=True, icmpv6_type=135, nd_target=self.vip) nd_action_list = ( 'set_field:136->icmpv6_type', 'move:NXM_OF_ETH_SRC[]->NXM_OF_ETH_DST[]', 'set_field:{mac}->eth_src'.format(mac=self.mac), 'move:NXM_NX_ND_SLL[]->NXM_NX_ND_TLL[]', 'set_field:{mac}->nd_sll'.format(mac=self.mac), 'set_field:{vip}->nd_target'.format(vip=self.vip), 'move:NXM_NX_IPV6_SRC[]->NXM_NX_IPV6_DST[]', 'set_field:{vip}->ipv6_src'.format(vip=self.vip), 'IN_PORT', ) nd_flow = gen_flow_string('add', nd_match, *nd_action_list, table=0, priority=PRIORITY_MED) vip_flows.append(nd_flow) # vip tcp fwd match tcp_match = dict(in_port=self.ofport) if self.vip.version == 4: tcp_match.update(tcp=True, ip_dst=self.vip) elif self.vip.version == 6: tcp_match.update(tcpv6=True, ipv6_dst=self.vip) tcp_action = 'group:{}'.format(SELECT_GROUP_ID) tcp_flow = gen_flow_string('add', tcp_match, tcp_action, table=0, priority=PRIORITY_MED) vip_flows.append(tcp_flow) ret, out, err = self.run_ofctl( cmd=OFCTL_ADD_FLOW_STDIN.format(distributor=self), stdinput='
'.join(vip_flows)) if ret == 0: return msg = _('Error creating vip flows for bridge %(br)s,' ' exist_status=%(ret)d' '
sterr=%(err)s' ) % dict(br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err) LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) def bring_if_up(self): ret, out, err = self.run_ofctl( OFCTL_IFUP.format(distributor=self)) if ret == 0: LOG.debug(_LI('interface %(iface)s is up on bridge %(br)s' ), dict(iface=self.iface, br=self.bridge)) return msg = _( 'Error bringing up interface %(iface)s on bridge %(br)s' ' exist_status=%(ret)d' '
sterr=%(err)s' ) % dict(iface=self.iface, br=self.bridge, ret=ret, err=err) LOG.error(msg) raise DistributorlError(msg) @staticmethod def _run(args, stdinput=None): try: pipe = subprocess.Popen(args, stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE) out, err = pipe.communicate(stdinput) ret = pipe.returncode if ret == 142: LOG.error(_LE('timeout while running cmd %(cmd)s.' '
stderr=%(err)s'), dict(cmd=args, err=err)) LOG.debug(_LI( 'finished running cmd %(cmd)s. exit_status=%(ret)d' '
stdout=%(out)s' '
stderr=%(err)s' '
stdin=%(inp)s' ), dict(cmd=args, ret=ret, err=err, out=out, inp=stdinput)) return ret, out, err except OSError: LOG.exception(_LE('OSError while running cmd %(cmd)s.'), dict(cmd=args)) return Distributor._OS_ERROR_CODE, None, None def run_vsctl(self, *cmd_list): args = ['sudo', 'ovs-vsctl', '-t', self.timeout, '--retry'] for cmd in cmd_list: args.append('--') args.extend(shlex.split(cmd)) return Distributor._run(args) def run_ofctl(self, cmd, extra=None, stdinput=None): args = ['sudo', 'ovs-ofctl', '-O', self.of_version, '-t', self.timeout] args.extend(shlex.split(cmd)) if extra is not None: args.extend(extra) return Distributor._run(args, stdinput) def gen_flow_string(action, match_dict, *actions_list, **flags): args = [] for key, value in six.iteritems(flags): args.append('{key}={value}'.format(key=key, value=value)) for key, value in six.iteritems(match_dict): if value is True: # careful, 1 is a valid value args.append('{key}'.format(key=key)) else: args.append('{key}={value}'.format(key=key, value=value)) args.append('actions={actions}'.format( actions=','.join(actions_list))) if action: return '{action} {flow}'.format(action=action, flow=','.join(args)) else: return ','.join(args) def gen_group_string(action, group_id, *bucket_list, **flags): args = ['group_id={id}'.format(id=group_id)] group_type = flags.pop('type', 'select') args.append('type={type}'.format(type=group_type)) if type == 'select': method = flags.pop('selection_method', 'hash') args.append('selection_method={method}'.format( method=method)) if method == 'hash': if 'selection_method_param' in flags: args.append('selection_method_param={param}'.format( param=flags.pop(['selection_method_param']))) fields = flags.pop('fields', None) if fields is None: pass elif isinstance(fields, (list, tuple)): args.append('fields=({fields})'.format( fields=','.join(fields))) else: args.append('fields={fields}'.format(fields=fields)) for key, value in six.iteritems(flags): args.append('{key}={value}'.format(key=key, value=value)) for bucket in bucket_list: args.append('bucket={bucket}'.format(bucket=bucket)) if action: return '{action} {group}'.format(action=action, group=','.join(args)) else: return ','.join(args) def gen_bucket_string(bucket_id, *actions_list, **flags): args = ['bucket_id:{id}'.format(id=bucket_id)] for key, value in six.iteritems(flags): args.append('{key}={value}'.format(key=key, value=value)) args.append('actions={actions}'.format( actions=','.join(actions_list))) return ','.join(args) def init_ovs(): if _ovs_is_initialized: return for attempt in range(WAIT_FOR_OVS_RETRIES): try: subprocess.check_call(['sudo', 'ovs-vsctl', 'init']) except subprocess.CalledProcessError: # Sleep with exponential-back off to allow ovs to finish # the after boot install. time.sleep(OVS_CMD_TIMEOUT << attempt) else: return raise DistributorlError(_( 'Giving up waiting for OVS init after %s retries' ) % WAIT_FOR_OVS_RETRIES) def gen_br_name(base): """ Create unused bridge name from base_name. Name must be short enough to be a valid iface name. Similar to neutron iface naming, but checks for collisions and tries alternative names. :param base: base name :return: bridge name """ name = BR_NAME_FORMAT.format(base)[:BR_NAME_LENGTH] if (name not in netifaces.interfaces() and all(d.bridge != name for d in _distributors)): return name # else try a few alternatives used_names = set.union(netifaces.interfaces(), (d.bridge for d in _distributors)) for alt_base in ('{i:02x}-{base}'.format(i=i, base=base) for i in range(0x100)): name = BR_NAME_FORMAT.format(alt_base)[:BR_NAME_LENGTH] if name not in used_names: return name raise DistributorlError(_('Could not find unused bridge name for %s' ) % base)

commit_message:
WIP: Active-Active Topology - invoke cluster LB create flow

- Add subflows to amphora_flows to support
LB creation for ACTIVE_ACTIVE Topology
- Add Create Load Balancer for ACTIVE_ACTIVE
Topology to Octavia Controller

Change-Id: I313ce5313eb437812caf5e6893953b35809fbca9

WIP: Active-Active Topology - Plug VIP to distributor with correct MAC

Sends correct distributor MAC over distributor REST post_plug_vip
call

Change-Id: I200200203e14ebd1609965890b7de51e22d5ca89

subject: WIP: Active-Active Topology - fix Security Group for Distributor
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 16:03:00.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/network/drivers/neutron/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/f6bc7cb6a5da6c6f8740330d07f00b40d05e18eb', 'message': 'WIP: Active-Active Topology - fix Security Group for Distributor

SG allows a port to send only traffic from specific IPs --
disables spoofing. Distributor must send traffic with
src_ip that is not its port ip (but IP of the client) to an amphora.
This commit lets distributor while staying in security group perform such
legal spoofing

Change-Id: I1f22982160fb1bb2582ce203c5d35719f82eda44
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Active-Active Topology - fix Security Group for Distributor

SG allows a port to send only traffic from specific IPs --
disables spoofing. Distributor must send traffic with
src_ip that is not its port ip (but IP of the client) to an amphora.
This commit lets distributor while staying in security group perform such
legal spoofing

Change-Id: I1f22982160fb1bb2582ce203c5d35719f82eda44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/12/359312/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Usage of flavor's get_service_profile_metainfo

Adding usage of neutron's flavor plugin new API
get_service_profile_metainfo by LBaaS's plugin.
This should be used by a selected provider to get choosen
flavor profile's meta when needed.

See neutron's flavor plugin change here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/318153.

Change-Id: I3baf2471ed20b06d2164b081452e8fd268363f01

commit_message:
Add new options to the net-update/net-create CLI

New options have been added to the net-create and net-update CLI.
Also, net-update CLI now displays all the possible updatable options.
Net-update CLI now shows the following information:
    --admin-state-up
    --shared
    --router:external

Net create now parses --router:external option.

Neutron advanced service flavors can use multiple providers, with

Change-Id: I433ed832bd6c95fdce7582fdc24674acf5f912ba

commit_message:
Add neutron-lbaas v2 providers to devstack if flavors enabled

Neutron advanced service flavors can use multiple providers, with
the flavor pointing to a flavor service profile containing the
desired provider including a non-default version, in v2 of
neutron-lbaas.

This patch adds a couple secondary neutron-lbaas providers to
the devstack configuration when 'q-flavors' is enabled.

Change-Id: I433ed832bd6c95fdce7582fdc24674acf5f912ba

commit_message:
Use upper constraints for all jobs in tox.ini

Openstack infra now supports upper constraints for
all jobs. Updated tox.ini to use upper constraints
for all jobs.

Change-Id: I1f31ac2761e793a7831676de520de08497e2fb95
Closes-Bug: #1614361
(cherry picked from commit 13f2b1ede108120b8466d2c45d14da29b2b47e24)

subject: Respect agent when policy does not allow to update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 11:32:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/v2/base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/135b81d3bfbe89a1dd4bbb4caa0644ba5ad3f968', 'message': "Respect agent when policy does not allow to update

When policy does not allow to perform update-agent,
neutron try to refer to 'tenant_id' of the agent in order to
judge whether 403 or 404 should be returned to client.

However, there is no 'tenant_id' attribute in agent.
Thus, accessing to 'tenant_id' is failed and unexpected error is returned.
It should be returned with 404.

Change-Id: Ie173ac7673b2f3a60f5d4048af8424810ea25750
Closes-Bug: #1610905
"}]
commit_message:
Respect agent when policy does not allow to update

When policy does not allow to perform update-agent,
neutron try to refer to 'tenant_id' of the agent in order to
judge whether 403 or 404 should be returned to client.

However, there is no 'tenant_id' attribute in agent.
Thus, accessing to 'tenant_id' is failed and unexpected error is returned.
It should be returned with 404.

Change-Id: Ie173ac7673b2f3a60f5d4048af8424810ea25750
Closes-Bug: #1610905

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Switch to inheriting hacking checks from neutron-lib""

This reverts commit 74e7df482c22c3e39898bd0c55dd24352740dbe4.

Note that this will break the following subprojects, which have not
merged their hacking fix for most of newton: dragonflow, networking-brocade,
networking-plumgrid, networking-vpshere

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-lib
Change-Id: I644a7a833fec8407b1f81530bd2f996828b6c4a2

commit_message:
Fixes failover flow with namespace driver

This patch updates the haproxy service scripts to handle the case
where the network interfaces have not yet been plugged.  This can
occur in a failover situation.
This patch also makes sure we don't move the management lan interface
into the network namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1509706
Closes-Bug: #1577963
Change-Id: I04d267bd3cdedca11f0350c5255086233cba14ec
(cherry picked from commit 7ba33e6ee4dd19757fe6f3a6bae513db49240c5e)

commit_message:
Clear SegmentHostMapping when deleting inactive agent

Admin can delete inactive L2 agent. But the SegmentHostMapping for that
agent will be left behind. This patch will clear the related
SegmentHostMapping when deleting inactive L2 agent.

Change-Id: I61dfaacf2a28bb8356ecc5f5cb12b20b2d857ddb
Partially-implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Save transaction when deleting floatingip_agent_gateway port

In dvr environment, after the last floatingip being deleted on one compute node,
the l3-agent will clear the fip namespace and call the neutron-server to delete the
floatingip_agent_gateway, but db transaction did not save after deleting the data,
so port date is still in the db.

Change-Id: Ic42a613663b226b15fd63c6f60380cfab87a7cf4
Closes-bug: #1560301

commit_message:
A ovs bridge can only get its own port attributes

When set port tag on the br-int, br-int calls method get_ports_attributes
and given ports or none which will get all current bridge port.
If given ports does not belong to br-int, the method still can return data,
when given ports belong to br-ex, this will cause the ports on the br-ex
to be set with the tag attribute, and network unreachable.

Need to confirm whether the given ports is in the current ovsbridge.

Change-Id: I037317c7783cfdf8feaca0b293ffe2f27a0c5d9d
Closes-bug: #1616815

commit_message:
Let vpn-agent respect FWaaS

Currently, we cannot use both of FWaaS and VPNaaS
because vpn-agent does not initialize FWaaS.
Class structure of FWaaS and VPNaaS causes this problem.

This patch changes structure of main class of VPNaaS.
When neutron-fwaas repository is detected,
select class that overrides main class of FWaaS as main class of VPNaaS.
On the other hand, when neutron-fwaas repository is not detected,
select class that does not override main class of FWaaS as main class of VPNaaS.

Change-Id: Ie1467743e332e8add2eeffed40b79959ae6aeda2
Closes-Bug: #1617268

added_lines: # Copyright 2013, Nachi Ueno, NTT I3, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from neutron_fwaas.services.firewall.agents.l3reference \ import firewall_l3_agent from neutron_fwaas.services.firewall.agents.l3reference \ import firewall_l3_agent_v2 from neutron_vpnaas.services.vpn import agent as vpn_agent class VPNAgentWithFWaaSV1(firewall_l3_agent.L3WithFWaaS, vpn_agent.VPNAgentCommon): """VPNAgent class which can handle vpn service drivers with FWaaS v1.""" def __init__(self, host, conf=None): super(VPNAgentWithFWaaSV1, self).__init__(host=host, conf=conf) self.initialize(host) def enqueue_state_change(self, router_id, state): """Handle HA router state changes for vpn process""" self.process_state_change(router_id, state) super(VPNAgentWithFWaaSV1, self).enqueue_state_change( router_id, state) class VPNAgentWithFWaaSV2(firewall_l3_agent_v2.L3WithFWaaS, vpn_agent.VPNAgentCommon): """VPNAgent class which can handle vpn service drivers with FWaaS v2.""" def __init__(self, host, conf=None): super(VPNAgentWithFWaaSV2, self).__init__(host=host, conf=conf) self.initialize(host) def enqueue_state_change(self, router_id, state): """Handle HA router state changes for vpn process""" self.process_state_change(router_id, state) super(VPNAgentWithFWaaSV2, self).enqueue_state_change( router_id, state)

commit_message:
py3:Rmove six.iteritems/iterkeys

1As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems/keys achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items/keys instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I7e1943ec11f68054127451614822e7aa4b6281fc

subject: Fixes get_devices_details_list... and update_device_list timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-23 15:03:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/685ba4eacf5c608e840aba7f3d18e8d1bcf5dccd', 'message': "Fixes get_devices_details_list_...() timeout

This patch fixes the issue with the RPC call
get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices() timing out in
scaled up environments. This patch builds upon the original
patch by Ed Bak for resolving this issue.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163594/

The reviewers were unable to reach a consensus because of
timeout vs pagination arguments. Since the RPC timeout
adjustment is already implemented by Kevin Benton's patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/ to add exponential
back off with RPC clients, I thought it made sense to
resurrect this patch and add dynamic division of devices
list into subsets to avoid timeouts.

This patch retries the call till reaching a threshold total
of 5 RPC timeouts, dividing the chunk size by half for each
retry. The least chunk size is kept as 1000.

There is a related patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284535/
but I believe this fix will hold good even with this one.

Change-Id: Id629e0a2ccc17c4fff3b19734e71bac95f66ae2f
Closes-Bug: #1430999

commit_message:
Fixes get_devices_details_list... and update_device_list timeout

This patch fixes the issue with the batch RPC call
get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices() and update_device_list()
timing out in scaled up environments. This patch builds upon the
original patch by Ed Bak for resolving this issue.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163594/

The reviewers were unable to reach a consensus because of timeout vs
pagination arguments. Since the RPC timeout adjustment is already
implemented by Kevin Benton's patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/ to add exponential back off
with RPC clients, it made sense to resurrect this patch and add
dynamic division of devices list into subsets to avoid timeouts.

This patch retries the call till reaching a threshold total of 5 RPC
timeouts, dividing the chunk size by half for each retry.
The least chunk size is kept as 100.

There is a related patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284535/
but I believe this fix will hold good even with this one.

Change-Id: Id629e0a2ccc17c4fff3b19734e71bac95f66ae2f
Closes-Bug: #1430999
Related-bug: #1528895
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/89/319989/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import itertools def test_get_device_list_chunks(self): for retry in range(0, 5): for i in range(3999, 4003): devices = range(0, i) # break up the list of devices into a list of smaller lists subset_size = max(len(devices) / (2 ** retry), 1000) device_subsets = list(self.agent._get_device_list_chunks( devices, subset_size)) # expand the list of smaller lists back into a single list device_subsets_expanded = list(itertools.chain( *device_subsets)) # verify that nothing was lost self.assertEqual(devices, device_subsets_expanded) def test_get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices_remote_error(self): raise_remote = oslo_messaging.RemoteError() raise_timeout = oslo_messaging.MessagingTimeout() valid_entry = range(999, 2998) devices = range(0, 3999) with mock.patch.object(self.agent.plugin_rpc, 'get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices', side_effect=(raise_timeout, valid_entry, raise_remote)): self.assertRaises( oslo_messaging.RemoteError, self.agent.get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices, devices) def test_get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices_timeout_error(self): raise_timeout = oslo_messaging.MessagingTimeout() valid_entry_iter0 = [999, 1001] valid_entry_iter1 = [50, 60, 70] valid_entry_iter2 = [1, 2, 3] valid_entry_iter3 = [99, 100, 101, 102] valid_entry_iter4 = [1001, 3001] valid_entry = (valid_entry_iter1 + valid_entry_iter2 + valid_entry_iter3 + valid_entry_iter4) devices = range(0, 3999) with mock.patch.object(self.agent.plugin_rpc, 'get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices', side_effect=(raise_timeout, valid_entry_iter0, raise_timeout, valid_entry_iter1, valid_entry_iter2, valid_entry_iter3, valid_entry_iter4, valid_entry_iter0)) as get_dd_list: devices_details_list = ( self.agent.get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices( devices)) self.assertEqual(7, get_dd_list.call_count) self.assertEqual(valid_entry, devices_details_list) def test_get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices_timeout_expired(self): raise_timeout = oslo_messaging.MessagingTimeout() valid_entry = range(999, 2998) devices = range(0, 3999) with mock.patch.object(self.agent.plugin_rpc, 'get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices', side_effect=(raise_timeout, valid_entry, raise_timeout, valid_entry, valid_entry, valid_entry, raise_timeout, valid_entry, valid_entry, raise_timeout, valid_entry, valid_entry, valid_entry, raise_timeout, valid_entry)) as get_dd_list: self.assertRaises( oslo_messaging.MessagingTimeout, self.agent.get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices, devices) self.assertEqual(14, get_dd_list.call_count)

commit_message:
DVR: Rename gateway variable in dvr_local_router to sn_port

While reviewing a patch I noticed there were some differences
in variable naming which might confuse the developers, so
renaming the variable 'gateway' to the appropriate name
'sn_port' so that it is in sync with all other variables.

Change-Id: I16d44362078f221da7dbdc6ee94140e2ec903686

commit_message:
[WIP] Use DATAPLANE events to notify l2pop

Use DATAPLANE events to notify mechanism drivers about port status
changes. This patch is to move postcommit notification from
update_port_status to dataplane events handler.

Change-Id: I8a72a98db0ab49079ca8099314a509d12c27950f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/77/363777/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: registry.subscribe(self._dataplane_wiring, resources.PORT, events.DATAPLANE_ACTIVE) registry.subscribe(self._dataplane_wiring, resources.PORT, events.DATAPLANE_INACTIVE) def _dataplane_wiring(self, rtype, event, trigger, context, object_id, **kwargs): original_port = kwargs['original_port'] updated_port = kwargs['updated_port'] host = kwargs['host'] status = kwargs['status'] status_updated = (original_port['status'] == updated_port['status']) distributed_port = updated_port['device_owner'] in [ const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_HA_INTF, const.DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_INTERFACE] # Notify when DVR and HA ports status changed to ACTIVE or DOWN if status == n_const.PORT_STATUS_BUILD and distributed_port: return # Return if no status change for normal port if not distributed_port and not status_updated: return # HA needs calling agent's host and port status if updated_port['device_owner'] == const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_HA_INTF: updated_port[portbindings.HOST_ID] = host updated_port['status'] = status port_context = self.get_bound_port_context( context, updated_port['id'], host) if port_context: self.mechanism_manager.update_port_postcommit(port_context) if updated:
deleted_lines: if (updated and port['device_owner'] == const.DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_INTERFACE): with session.begin(subtransactions=True): port = db.get_port(session, port_id) if not port: LOG.warning(_LW("Port %s not found during update"), port_id) return original_port = self._make_port_dict(port) network = network or self.get_network( context, original_port['network_id']) port.status = db.generate_distributed_port_status(session, port['id']) updated_port = self._make_port_dict(port) levels = db.get_binding_levels(session, port_id, host) mech_context = (driver_context.PortContext( self, context, updated_port, network, binding, levels, original_port=original_port)) self.mechanism_manager.update_port_precommit(mech_context) if updated: self.mechanism_manager.update_port_postcommit(mech_context)

commit_message:
WIP: Switch fullstack tests to use rootwrap

WIP: I'm seeing these TRACES in the logs for various commands:
RuntimeError: Second simultaneous read on fileno 10 detected.
http://paste.openstack.org/show/490441/
I've also experienced tests that hang indefinitely, seemingly
not adhering to the global test timeout. Impressive!

Change-Id: I2ced7c7e22090286a743ba72f78d5f5c352b2f78

commit_message:
Delete a couple of negative FIPs API tests

API tests for core resources belong in Tempest. The dependent
patch copies over the tests to the Tempest directory so we
can delete them in this patch.

Related-Bug: #1552960
Change-Id: If15f92d51d150f619e4a0fee86f3689186c68123
Depends-On: I250ca9c277d8cce30563436707af5a85d295efeb

commit_message:
Remove a remaining reference to mm-ctl

mm-ctl is used for MidoNet interface driver, which has been
moved to networking-midonet repository while ago.

networking-midonet's devstack plugin installs its own
rootwrap filters which covers mm-ctl. [1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/networking-midonet/blob/master/devstack/midonet_rootwrap.filters

Related-Bug: #1510826
Related-blueprint: core-vendor-decomposition
Change-Id: I9b23f282e6897a519e0426e83629b2802f8fcea7

commit_message:
Add scope id to SUBNETPOOL_ADDRESS_SCOPE event

Add 'orig_address_scope_id' and 'new_address_scope_id' to
the notify callback of SUBNETPOOL_ADDRESS_SCOPE's
AFTER_UPDATE event

Closes-bug: #1598735

added_lines: from debtcollector import movesfrom neutron_lib.utils import file as utils_file from neutron_lib.utils import helpers as utils_helpers from neutron_lib.utils import net as utils_netensure_dir = moves.moved_function( utils_file.ensure_dir, 'ensure_dir', __name__)parse_mappings = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.parse_mappings, 'parse_mappings', __name__) get_hostname = moves.moved_function( utils_net.get_hostname, 'get_hostname', __name__)compare_elements = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.compare_elements, 'compare_elements', __name__) safe_sort_key = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.safe_sort_key, 'safe_sort_key', __name__) dict2str = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.dict2str, 'dict2str', __name__) str2dict = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.str2dict, 'str2dict', __name__) dict2tuple = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.dict2tuple, 'dict2tuple', __name__) diff_list_of_dict = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.diff_list_of_dict, 'diff_list_of_dict', __name__)get_random_string = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.get_random_string, 'get_random_string', __name__)cpu_count = moves.moved_function( utils_host.cpu_count, 'cpu_count', __name__)camelize = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.camelize, 'camelize', __name__) round_val = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.round_val, 'round_val', __name__) replace_file = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.replace_file, 'replace_file', __name__)safe_decode_utf8 = moves.moved_function( utils_helpers.safe_decode_utf8, 'safe_decode_utf8', __name__)
deleted_lines: """Utilities and helper functions.""" def ensure_dir(dir_path): """Ensure a directory with 755 permissions mode.""" try: os.makedirs(dir_path, 0o755) except OSError as e: # If the directory already existed, don't raise the error. if e.errno != errno.EEXIST: raisedef parse_mappings(mapping_list, unique_values=True, unique_keys=True): """Parse a list of mapping strings into a dictionary. :param mapping_list: a list of strings of the form '<key>:<value>' :param unique_values: values must be unique if True :param unique_keys: keys must be unique if True, else implies that keys and values are not unique :returns: a dict mapping keys to values or to list of values """ mappings = {} for mapping in mapping_list: mapping = mapping.strip() if not mapping: continue split_result = mapping.split(':') if len(split_result) != 2: raise ValueError(_("Invalid mapping: '%s'") % mapping) key = split_result[0].strip() if not key: raise ValueError(_("Missing key in mapping: '%s'") % mapping) value = split_result[1].strip() if not value: raise ValueError(_("Missing value in mapping: '%s'") % mapping) if unique_keys: if key in mappings: raise ValueError(_("Key %(key)s in mapping: '%(mapping)s' not " "unique") % {'key': key, 'mapping': mapping}) if unique_values and value in mappings.values(): raise ValueError(_("Value %(value)s in mapping: '%(mapping)s' " "not unique") % {'value': value, 'mapping': mapping}) mappings[key] = value else: mappings.setdefault(key, []) if value not in mappings[key]: mappings[key].append(value) return mappings def get_hostname(): return socket.gethostname()def compare_elements(a, b): """Compare elements if a and b have same elements. This method doesn't consider ordering """ if a is None: a = [] if b is None: b = [] return set(a) == set(b) def safe_sort_key(value): """Return value hash or build one for dictionaries.""" if isinstance(value, collections.Mapping): return sorted(value.items()) return value def dict2str(dic): return ','.join("%s=%s" % (key, val) for key, val in sorted(six.iteritems(dic))) def str2dict(string): res_dict = {} for keyvalue in string.split(','): (key, value) = keyvalue.split('=', 1) res_dict[key] = value return res_dict def dict2tuple(d): items = list(d.items()) items.sort() return tuple(items) def diff_list_of_dict(old_list, new_list): new_set = set([dict2str(l) for l in new_list]) old_set = set([dict2str(l) for l in old_list]) added = new_set - old_set removed = old_set - new_set return [str2dict(a) for a in added], [str2dict(r) for r in removed]def get_random_string(length): """Get a random hex string of the specified length. """ return "{0:0{1}x}".format(random.getrandbits(length * 4), length)def cpu_count(): try: return multiprocessing.cpu_count() except NotImplementedError: return 1def camelize(s): return ''.join(s.replace('_', ' ').title().split()) def round_val(val): # we rely on decimal module since it behaves consistently across Python # versions (2.x vs. 3.x) return int(decimal.Decimal(val).quantize(decimal.Decimal('1'), rounding=decimal.ROUND_HALF_UP)) def replace_file(file_name, data, file_mode=0o644): """Replaces the contents of file_name with data in a safe manner. First write to a temp file and then rename. Since POSIX renames are atomic, the file is unlikely to be corrupted by competing writes. We create the tempfile on the same device to ensure that it can be renamed. """ base_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(file_name)) with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile('w+', dir=base_dir, delete=False) as tmp_file: tmp_file.write(data) os.chmod(tmp_file.name, file_mode) os.rename(tmp_file.name, file_name)def safe_decode_utf8(s): if six.PY3 and isinstance(s, bytes): return s.decode('utf-8', 'surrogateescape') return s

commit_message:
Fix response codes of API ref

API reference sometimes mixes a normal response code and error codes.
This patch arranges these wrong codes.

Change-Id: I5cc4e978836d60b1930ea47996717826da56d283
Closes-Bug: #1611182

commit_message:
agent: dhcp: drop input from remote subnets

When connected to a public network, the DHCP agent would answer
recursive DNS queries coming from anywhere on the internet, which can be
used to amplify DDoS attacks.

This commit adds iptables rules that allow traffic coming from the
subnet to which the DHCP agent is connected, and drop everything else.

Closes-bug: 1501206
Change-Id: Ifc93a6f9ab8a553ba440e6284d08f6786131683a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/256280/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.drop_input_from_remote_subnets(network) % constants.DHCP_CLIENT_PORT) def drop_input_from_remote_subnets(self, network): """Drop requests to the DHCP agent coming from remote subnets.""" iptables_mgr = iptables_manager.IptablesManager(use_ipv6=True, namespace=network.namespace) tables = { 4: iptables_mgr.ipv4['filter'], 6: iptables_mgr.ipv6['filter'] } for table in tables.itervalues(): table.add_rule('INPUT', '-m conntrack --ctstate RELATED,ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT') tables[4].add_rule('INPUT', '-p udp -s 0.0.0.0 --sport %d ' '-d 255.255.255.255 --dport %d -j ACCEPT' % (constants.DHCP_CLIENT_PORT, constants.DHCP_SERVER_PORT)) link_local = {'ip_version': 6, 'cidr': 'fe80::/10'} for subnet in network.subnets + [link_local]: tables[subnet['ip_version']].add_rule('INPUT', '-s %s -j ACCEPT' % subnet['cidr']) for table in tables.itervalues(): table.add_rule('INPUT', '-j DROP') iptables_mgr.apply()

This adds registry events for when the agent notifies the server

commit_message:
[wip]: add registry events for port dataplane wiring

This adds registry events for when the agent notifies the server
of dataplane activities (port finished wiring, port taken offline).
These events can be used by things like L2pop and DVR that need
to perform actions in reaction to these events. Previously they were
relying on overloading the update_port_status handler with a bunch
of logic unrelated to updating a ports status.

Change-Id: Ia2d94f6def081e0b2b84e509aec67e4d4ff48e09

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE Trying to figure out why this unit test fails

This was the way I originally wrote this unit test. I had to change it
because it would fail intermittently in the check queue. I was never
able to get it to fail locally though so it was difficult figure out
what was going wrong. There is some more context where originally
posted this test [1].

Basically, recording the IPs would get a FK constraint failure. We
suspected that it must be the port_id constraint because the network
and subnets have been committed to the DB by the time the constraint
was violated. But, I'm not sure why the port wouldn't be there. It was
already added to the transaction (but not committed).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/348956/7

Change-Id: I9d05520822b3740aadf72a312c28e5444bfc87fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/42/353642/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: store.call_count += 1 if store.call_count != 2: return orig(context, ip_address, *args, **kwargs) # If we got here, then this is the second call to # _store_ip_allocation. At this point, there was one successful IP # allocation recorded. IPAM has allocated a second IP address but # it hasn't been recorded because we intercepted it and we're here. # Now, simulate a race by taking the same address. self._create_port( self.fmt, net_id=net['network']['id'], fixed_ips=[{'ip_address': ip_address}]) try: # This will conflict and trigger IPAM rollback. # Flush ensures that the duplicate exception is raised in the # context where the IPAM rollback will be triggered and the # exception "breaks" the session by triggering DB rollback. store.call_count = 0 with mock.patch.object(Backend, '_store_ip_allocation', wraps=store): with mock.patch.object(Backend, '_safe_rollback', wraps=rollback): # When all goes well, retry kicks in and the operation is successfull.
deleted_lines: import copy # Ensure DBDuplicate exception is raised in the context where IPAM # rollback is triggered. It "breaks" the session because it triggers DB # rollback. Inserting a flush in _store_ip_allocation does this. try: # Create a port to conflict with later. Simulates a race for addresses. result = self._create_port( self.fmt, net_id=net['network']['id'], fixed_ips=[{'subnet_id': subnet1['subnet']['id']}, {'subnet_id': subnet2['subnet']['id']}]) port = self.deserialize(self.fmt, result) fixed_ips = port['port']['fixed_ips'] # Hands out the same 2nd IP to create conflict and trigger rollback ips = [{'subnet_id': fixed_ips[0]['subnet_id'], 'ip_address': fixed_ips[0]['ip_address']}, {'subnet_id': fixed_ips[1]['subnet_id'], 'ip_address': fixed_ips[1]['ip_address']}] def alloc(*args, **kwargs): def increment_address(a): a['ip_address'] = str(netaddr.IPAddress(a['ip_address']) + 1) # Increment 1st address to return a free address on the first call increment_address(ips[0]) try: return copy.deepcopy(ips) finally: # Increment 2nd address to return free address on the 2nd call increment_address(ips[1]) with mock.patch.object(Backend, '_store_ip_allocation', wraps=store),\ mock.patch.object(Backend, '_safe_rollback', wraps=rollback),\ mock.patch.object(Backend, '_allocate_ips_for_port', wraps=alloc): # When all goes well, retry kicks in and the operation is successful.

commit_message:
[RFC] scenario tests for security groups

Introduce scenario tests to test single security group in isolation. The
existing security group functional tests are limited to testing only
traffic which can be generate by ping and netcat, and this approach is
incompatible with SDN approaches like OVN. These tests use an isolated
network between two instances, one of which has port security disabled,
so only the effects of a single firewall are under tests. By using two
instances and the intervening network, firewall technologies which are
integrated with switching such as OVSFW can be tested.

Initially just testing the test setup.

Change-Id: Ifdd273d5e70651c0908e3f6ca6931142de1e7c5b

added_lines: @classmethod def setup_network_and_server_pair(cls, **kwargs): """Setup a pair of servers with a new network between them. The first server's port on the new network is configured with kwargs, while the second server's port on the network has port security disabled. This allowed testing security group and allowed address pair behavior. """ cls.keypair = cls.create_keypair() cls.create_loginable_secgroup_rule() cls.server1 = cls.create_server( flavor_ref=CONF.compute.flavor_ref, image_ref=CONF.compute.image_ref, key_name=cls.keypair['name']) cls.server2 = cls.create_server( flavor_ref=CONF.compute.flavor_ref, image_ref=CONF.compute.image_ref, key_name=cls.keypair['name']) waiters.wait_for_server_status(cls.manager.servers_client, cls.server1['server']['id'], constants.SERVER_STATUS_ACTIVE) waiters.wait_for_server_status(cls.manager.servers_client, cls.server2['server']['id'], constants.SERVER_STATUS_ACTIVE) cls.server1_access_port = cls.client.list_ports(device_id=cls.server1[ 'server']['id'])['ports'][0] cls.server2_access_port = cls.client.list_ports(device_id=cls.server2[ 'server']['id'])['ports'][0] cls.network = cls.create_network() cls.subnet = cls.create_subnet(cls.network) cls.server1_test_port = cls.create_port(cls.network, **kwargs) cls.server2_test_port = cls.create_port(cls.network, port_security_enabled=False) cls.manager.interfaces_client.create_keypair(cls.server1['id'], port_id=cls.server1_test_port['id']) cls.manager.interfaces_client.create_keypair(cls.server2['id'], port_id=cls.server2_test_port['id']) # TODO wait for port attach

[WIP] Adding filters in get_subnets method call

This patch adds a filter enable_dhcp=True in get_subnets
method call and removes the conditional statement that
does the same.

commit_message:
[WIP] Adding Port Statistics to Neutron Metering Agent

Currently the Neutron Metering Agent only measures the bandwidth usage of the
Routers. The Neutron Metering Agent is extended to also support Port statistics
using the OpenvSwitch tools.

Change-Id: Idfd3091e9b9af80c3fdcc623f3fd6e1631d7e342
Closes-Bug: #1592918
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/77/344977/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.agent.common import ovs_lib from neutron.db import models_v2 from neutron.db.metering import metering_db from neutron.services.metering.drivers import abstract_driver class NeutronPortStats(abstract_driver.NeutronPortStatsAbstractDriver): """NeutronPortStats class is responsible for adding Port statistics metrics using the OpenvSwitch tools. """ def __init__(self, session): self.data = [] self.all_port_stats = [] def get_tenant_id_from_meter_label(self, session): tenant_id = session.query(metering_db.MeteringLabel).first()['tenant_id'] return tenant_id def get_port_id_list_from_neutron_db(self, session, tenant_id): port_list = [] for port in session.query(models_v2.Port).filter_by(tenant_id=tenant_id): port_list.append(port['id']) return port_list def populate_stats_for_all_ports (self): ovs = ovs_lib.BaseOVS() self.data = ovs.ovsdb.db_list('Interface', columns=['name', 'external_ids','statistics']).execute() for d in self.data: if bool(d[u'external_ids']): self.all_port_stats.append({ 'port_id': d[u'external_ids'][u'iface-id'], 'port_name': d[u'name'], 'switch.port.receive.packets' : d[u'statistics'][u'rx_packets'], 'switch.port.transmit.packets' : d[u'statistics'][u'tx_packets'], 'switch.port.receive.bytes' : d[u'statistics'][u'rx_bytes'], 'switch.port.transmit.bytes' : d[u'statistics'][u'tx_bytes'], 'switch.port.receive.drops' : d[u'statistics'][u'rx_dropped'], 'switch.port.transmit.drops' : d[u'statistics'][u'tx_dropped'], 'switch.port.receive.errors' : d[u'statistics'][u'rx_errors'], 'switch.port.transmit.errors' : d[u'statistics'][u'tx_errors'], 'switch.port.receive.frame_error' : d[u'statistics'][u'rx_frame_err'], 'switch.port.receive.overrun_error' : d[u'statistics'][u'rx_over_err'], 'switch.port.receive.crc_error' : d[u'statistics'][u'rx_crc_err'], 'switch.port.collision.count' : d[u'statistics'][u'collisions'] }) def populate_stats_for_tenant_ports(self, session): self.populate_stats_for_all_ports() meter_label_tenant_id = self.get_tenant_id_from_meter_label(session) tenant_port_id_list = self.get_port_id_list_from_neutron_db( session, meter_label_tenant_id) tenant_port_stats = []

commit_message:
Make port-aggregation more efficient

Currently, get_port_mask takes O(n^2) to calculate port
aggregation list. This patch reduce the time complexity to O(n)
by first determine the boundary, and aggregate lower part and
upper part respectively. n refers to the bit number of port in the
above context.

Change-Id: I0887d7cc14f4496894df915dfe0ba1615e40c711
Closes-Bug: 1599037

Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack
style guidelines they recommend to import only modules[1].

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

commit_message:
WIP: Remove unnecsary update_port_down rpc call in SR-IOV agent

When a port is deleted neutron server already updates the port
status to down, it is redundent to send an update status rpc
message from the SR-IOV agent's 'treat_devices_removed' method

Change-Id: I737fd2b0fabd37d5cb0960e053d69c64ad2d6f64

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 11:42:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/segments/db.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/managers.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fd38608ea91582b1de86bd556a6ae3b30c84e6eb', 'message': '[WIP] Unify the code path to create segment

Now there are 2 code path to create segment, they are [1], [2].
[1] will be called when the segment is reserved, while [2] will
reserve segment when execution.

This patch will unify the code path to one. This can avoid the duplicated
segment reserve issue.

[1] neutron.db.segments_db.add_network_segment
[2] neutron.services.segments.plugin.Plugin.create_segment

Change-Id: I8fd4e45f58131afde8a97f1a13a796d9ab81e445
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Unify the code path to create segment

Now there are 2 code path to create segment, they are [1], [2].
[1] will be called when the segment is reserved, while [2] will
reserve segment when execution.

This patch will unify the code path to one. This can avoid the duplicated
segment reserve issue.

[1] neutron.db.segments_db.add_network_segment
[2] neutron.services.segments.plugin.Plugin.create_segment

Change-Id: I8fd4e45f58131afde8a97f1a13a796d9ab81e445
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/47/359147/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _handle_segment_change(self, rtype, event, trigger, context, segment, from_external): if not from_external: # It is a event that originated from external request. Notify # mechanism driver about network segments change. try: self._notify_mechanism_driver_for_segment_change( event, context, network_id) except ml2_exc.MechanismDriverError: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("mechanism_manager error occurred when " "handle event %(event)s for segment " "'%(segment)s'"), {'event': event, 'segment': segment['id']})
deleted_lines: from neutron.services.segments import plugin as segments_plugin def _handle_segment_change(self, rtype, event, trigger, context, segment): if (event == events.PRECOMMIT_CREATE and not isinstance(trigger, segments_plugin.Plugin)): # TODO(xiaohhui): Now, when create network, ml2 will reserve # segment and trigger this event handler. This event handler # will reserve segment again, which will lead to error as the # segment has already been reserved. This check could be removed # by unifying segment creation procedure. return try: self._notify_mechanism_driver_for_segment_change( event, context, network_id) except ml2_exc.MechanismDriverError: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("mechanism_manager error occurred when " "handle event %(event)s for segment " "'%(segment)s'"), {'event': event, 'segment': segment['id']})

commit_message:
Add an extension to get availability for subnetpools

This extension allows monitoring the availability of addresses within
a subnetpool through the API. For now, I'm just posting this for
comment. I modeled this a little after the network-ip availability
extension but I wonder if it would be better to just show this
information on the subnetpool resource.

Change-Id: If415b4b12a9b9b3ad9faafb1918ffb53e3f84338

commit_message:
Revert "Make l2/l3 operations retriable at plugin level"

Investigating what caused rally tests failures.
Related-Bug: #1623009

This reverts commit acbabaa3db2c12a41c52662a82e9a900d5929846.

Change-Id: I3733543d930899fb0f8d3fe18e706f972f020e82

commit_message:
WIP: Serialize conflicting requests in task queue

In ML2 mechanism driver, OVN updates are performed in post-commit,
which is after neutron DB transaction. With multi-workers/nodes,
the order of OVN updates are not guaranteed, which means the order
of OVN updates can be different from that of DB transaction commit
when there are racings between workers/nodes. This will result in
inconsistent data between OVN and Neutron DB.

This patch fixes the problem by serializing conflicting requests
in a task queue in DB. A place holder is marked in the queue in
precommit within the same DB transaction of the neutron DB change,
and during postcommit it checks and waits if there are conflicting
changes pending in the queue. This ensures ordering while keeping
the sync behaviour unchanged from client point of view, i.e. it
doesn't return until ovn nb operation complete.

TODO:
- Now only port-update is involved, other operations TBD
- Indirect dependency mentioned by bug #1611852 will be fixed in
a separate patch

Closes-bug: #1605089
Change-Id: If1a3a9e1841b7539a678a01182985cacb19d9dcc

added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import datetime from sqlalchemy import asc from sqlalchemy import func from sqlalchemy import or_ from networking_ovn.common import constants as ovn_const from networking_ovn.db import models from neutron.db import api as db_api from oslo_db import api as oslo_db_api def process_req_if_ready(session, req_uuid, obj_type, obj_uuid, timeout): with session.begin(): now = session.execute(func.now()).scalar() row = session.query(models.OvnTaskQueue).filter( or_(models.OvnTaskQueue.state == ovn_const.PENDING, models.OvnTaskQueue.state == ovn_const.PROCESSING), models.OvnTaskQueue.object_uuid == obj_uuid).filter( or_(models.OvnTaskQueue.created_at > now - datetime.timedelta(seconds=timeout), models.OvnTaskQueue.req_uuid == req_uuid)).order_by( asc(models.OvnTaskQueue.created_at)).with_for_update( ).first() if row and row.req_uuid == req_uuid: update_db_row_state(session, row, ovn_const.PROCESSING) return row return None @oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry(max_retries=db_api.MAX_RETRIES, retry_on_request=True) def update_db_row_state(session, row, state): row.state = state session.merge(row) session.flush() @oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry(max_retries=db_api.MAX_RETRIES, retry_on_request=True) def delete_row(session, row=None, row_id=None): if row_id: row = session.query(models.OvnTaskQueue).filter_by( id=row_id).one() if row: session.delete(row) session.flush() @oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry(max_retries=db_api.MAX_RETRIES, retry_on_request=True) def create_pending_row(session, req_uuid, object_type, object_uuid, operation, data): row = models.OvnTaskQueue(req_uuid=req_uuid, object_type=object_type, object_uuid=object_uuid, operation=operation, data=data, created_at=func.now(), state=ovn_const.PENDING) session.add(row) session.flush()

commit_message:
WIP: Fix address set adding & removing race condition

The fix is based on the task queue solution, with extra check
for ip changes in port data, to make sure addition of IP(s) is
not executed until pending deletions of same IP(s) on same
security-group(s) are completed.

TODO:
- This is RFC with port-updates changes only, port-create/delete TBD
- Add test cases (fix for race condition verified locally by adding
  sleep when deleting IPs from ports)

Closes-bug: #1611852
Change-Id: I88a97963af5a1810d5a6dd76df13524ef5e88625
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/94/362494/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from networking_ovn.common import aclimport six def port_ip_change(operation, data): if operation == ovn_const.ACTION_CREATE: old_port = {} new_port = data elif operation == ovn_const.ACTION_DELETE: old_port = data new_port = {} else: # update old_port = data['original'] new_port = data['current'] new_ips = set() for ips in six.itervalues(acl.acl_port_ips(new_port)): new_ips |= set(ips) old_ips = set() for ips in six.itervalues(acl.acl_port_ips(old_port)): old_ips |= set(ips) added_ips = new_ips - old_ips deleted_ips = old_ips - new_ips added_to_sgs = set(new_port.get('security_groups', [])) deleted_from_sgs = set(old_port.get('security_groups', [])) return added_ips, deleted_ips, added_to_sgs, deleted_from_sgs def has_indirect_dependency(session, row, timeout, now): """Check if there are indirectly depended updates pending. :return: True - if there are depended updates pending. False - if there are no dependencies """ if row.object_type == ovn_const.OBJ_TYPE_PORT: # If there are IP changes, there could be conflicting updates for # address-set. See details in bug #1611852. # Here we make sure addition of IP(s) is not executed until pending # deletions of same IP(s) on same security-group(s) are completed. added_ips, _, added_to_sgs, _ = port_ip_change(row.operation, row.data) if added_ips and added_to_sgs: with session.begin(subtransactions=True): rows = session.query(models.OvnTaskQueue).filter( or_(models.OvnTaskQueue.state == ovn_const.PENDING, models.OvnTaskQueue.state == ovn_const.PROCESSING), models.OvnTaskQueue.object_type == ovn_const.OBJ_TYPE_PORT, models.OvnTaskQueue.created_at > now - datetime.timedelta(seconds=timeout), models.OvnTaskQueue.created_at < row.created_at).all() for r in rows: _, deleted_ips, _, deleted_from_sgs = port_ip_change( r.operation, r.data) if (deleted_ips & added_ips) and ( deleted_from_sgs & added_to_sgs): return True else: # TODO(zhouhan): add dependency check for other object types pass return False if not has_indirect_dependency(session, row, timeout, now): update_db_row_state(session, row, ovn_const.PROCESSING) return row

commit_message:
[WIP] Modify plugin verification for OVN VPN gateway

This patch is changed for the plugin verification for OVN+VPN solution:
there is no router external ip any more, but instead use vpn gateway
external ip, more details can find in patch:
   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/341393

Depends-On: I4b90288c9c04d0c45ddf4e69f80825a236721781

Change-Id: I78c23fda86474ee4e7c508b5be8ecabb18c8b35d
Related-Bug: 1586253

added_lines: # (c) Copyright 2016 IBM Corporation, All Rights Reserved. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import netaddr from neutron import context as nctx from neutron import manager from neutron.plugins.common import constants as nconstants from neutron_vpnaas.db.vpn import vpn_ext_gw_db from neutron_vpnaas.extensions import vpnaas from neutron_vpnaas.services.vpn.service_drivers import ipsec_validator class OVNVpnValidator(ipsec_validator.IpsecVpnValidator): # overwrite validator function to use vpn gw external ip def __init__(self, service_plugin): super(OVNVpnValidator, self).__init__(service_plugin) @property def vpn_plugin(self): try: return self._vpn_plugin except AttributeError: self._vpn_plugin = manager.NeutronManager.get_service_plugins().\ get(nconstants.VPN) return self._vpn_plugin def _check_router(self, context, router_id): gateway = self.vpn_plugin.get_vpn_gw_dict_by_router_id( context, router_id) if gateway is None or gateway['external_fixed_ips'] is None: raise vpn_ext_gw_db.RouterIsNotVPNExternal(router_id=router_id) def _validate_peer_address(self, ip_version, router): context = nctx.get_admin_context() gateway = self.vpn_plugin.get_vpn_gw_dict_by_router_id( context, router['id']) if gateway is None or gateway['external_fixed_ips'] is None: raise vpn_ext_gw_db.RouterIsNotVPNExternal(router_id=router.id) for fixed_ip in gateway['external_fixed_ips']: addr = fixed_ip['ip_address'] if ip_version == netaddr.IPAddress(addr).version: return raise vpnaas.ExternalNetworkHasNoSubnet( router_id=router.id, ip_version='IPv6' if ip_version == 6 else "IPv4")

commit_message:
Update resource versions during agent update

We have more context on agent state change inside
AgentDBMixin._create_or_update_agent() so we can avoid
hackish modification of agent_state dict.

Related-Bug: #1573843
Change-Id: I04057fd73e4bcec91a3e6bf4b6fa6da4fe27a0df

commit_message:
Refactor agent state report handling on server side

Agent state reports processing on server may become a bottleneck at
scale so we should try to minimize the logic there.
This patch refactores agent state processing by getting diff
of current and new agent state and only processing what changed.
Previous agent state was fetched from db before this patch so we're
not introducing additional db query here.

Thus the patch simplifies the logic of updating segments to hosts
mappings: we only update if new bridge mappings reported by agent
differ from bridge mappings already stored in db.

Closes-Bug: #1573843
Change-Id: I5d94cc7bf4e7f80187a06bc5ba75079e876ef5ce

added_lines: def test_no_version_updates_if_no_versions_change(self): agent_state=self.agent_state, def test_version_updates_if_versions_change(self): #agent was upgraded and now uses object A of version 1.1 updated_versions = {"A": "1.1"} second_agent_state['agent_state']['resource_versions'].update( updated_versions) mock.ANY, updated_versions) mock.ANY, mock.ANY, mock.ANY, updated_versions)
deleted_lines: def test_no_version_updates_on_further_state_reports(self): second_agent_state = copy.deepcopy(self.agent_state) second_agent_state['agent_state'].pop('resource_versions') agent_state=second_agent_state, def test_version_updates_on_agent_revival(self): second_agent_state['agent_state'].pop('resource_versions') self._take_down_agent() # agent didn't include resource_versions in report but server will # take them from db for the revived agent mock.ANY, TEST_RESOURCE_VERSIONS) mock.ANY, mock.ANY, mock.ANY, TEST_RESOURCE_VERSIONS) def _take_down_agent(self): with self.context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): query = self.context.session.query(agents_db.Agent) agt = query.first() agt.heartbeat_timestamp = ( agt.heartbeat_timestamp - datetime.timedelta(hours=1))

commit_message:
Fix KeyError on SIGTERM with native of_interface

The error appeared because AppManager.close() was
called twice, trying to uninstantiate apps that have
already been uninstantiated.
The patch solves the problem by calling app.stop()
instead of AppManager.close() in cleanup.

Change-Id: Ia823c97559d87e020fa91480e96a3768373064ef
Closes-Bug: #1589746
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/37/326437/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import gcfrom ryu.app import wsgifrom ryu.lib import hub app_mgr = app_manager.AppManager.get_instance() app_mgr.load_apps( ['neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.' 'openflow.native.ovs_ryuapp']) contexts = app_mgr.create_contexts() services = app_mgr.instantiate_apps(**contexts) webapp = wsgi.start_service(app_mgr) if webapp: services.append(hub.spawn(webapp)) try: # NOTE(ivasilevskaya) this will block until all threads are finished or # an error is raised. In case of error-free execution further # processing means that close() has already been called and services # have already been cleaned up hub.joinall(services) finally: # In case of error-free operation all but probably webapp thread have # already been taken care of for t in services: t.kill() hub.joinall(services) gc.collect()
